comment: We stayed at Malia Bali for 7 nights, and the different facilities, restaurants and activities available daily kept our long stay fun and exciting, never a dull moment. What I loved most was all the staff that works that Melia, each one of them are so friendly and kind, and as a collective, they've made our stay at the resort 200% better, and a special mention to a few that we've interact with:  Ian - he initially took us on the Uluwatu Temple excursion and we were so impressed by his enthusiasm as he was explaining about the temple during the bus ride there. During the excursion, he was always offering to help us take photos and was very willing to answer our questions along the way. The very next day, we attended a couple of water activities session that Ian also hosted, water
author: Charles L

comment: We travelled as a family of four in August for a week. This was an impulse book last October during covid so we got it for an amazing price. We booked The Level and all inclusive which was well worth it. We came across people who upgraded whilst there because the food and drink wasn’t cheap. We liked the separate Level pool, the staff here were so attentive but not overbearing, nothing was too much trouble and they even cleaned everyone’s glasses each day!  We had a 2 storey family room which was fine, although the stairs were painful to walk on in bare feet. The toiletries and snacks were changed every day and it was kept clean. Room service was also included (bonus!) The only niggle would be the lack of variety on the menus and the constant hassle by beach sellers.  The staff
author: Caroline B

comment: We have just spent 6 nights here. We started off with the Level Romance Suite. After 2 nights we asked to be moved as our suite was at the very far end of the resort and my husband has a bad knee. We were given the opportunity to upgrade to a lagoon access suite, mid sections. Boy best decision ever. The better location really helped a lot, but it was being able to open your doors, take 4 steps and sink into the cool and pristine waters of the lagoon pool, that took our experience from average to fantastic.   Our only complaint, which others have commented on, is their breakfast. It is lack luster, lacks variety, and could be so much better. None of the toasters worked properly, the scrambled eggs at the buffet were of the powered kind (although you could ask for them to be made
author: Kate T

comment: First time staying in Nusa Dua and booked Melia after reading many positive reviews. The hotel and facilities were beautiful and the staff were very friendly and attentive. But everything else was disappointing.   Food and beverages are extremely expensive when you don’t book the all inclusive package. The food was very average despite having 4 restaurants in the resort. Buffet breakfast options were lacking and the food was pretty much the same at every outlet. Room service would take forever to arrive and they were missing basic items like herbal tea. Only 2 small complimentary bottles of water provided everyday and if you wanted to purchase any additional bottled water, it was over $6 AUD for a 600ml bottle.  Not a lot of activities or experiences available except for kids
author: Bela B

comment: This hotel is in a beautiful setting probably one of the best we’ve seen in a very long time. The staff are lovely and cannot do enough for you aside from some minor issues detailed below . Communication is a little bit lacking in terms of what is happening and then responding to you, which I do think would improve things. However, overall, this is definitely a five star in terms of the layout, cleanliness, facilities and food.  I would recommended and certainly return .   Laguna room is worth the upgrade to swim out into the pool it really was magical and with room service included breakfast or dinner by the pool was a bonus.   Room service and mini bar included in all inclusive lovely touch - quick and nice selection too . All inclusive worth while as all items provided making
author: Kar0n

comment: We stayed at the Melia, Nusa Dua, Bali for 12 nights. I would describe the overall appearance of the hotel as traditional Bali inspired.   We stayed in a lagoon pool access suite with the ‘level’ access.  Was amazing to be able to sit in a recliner at the back of your room and then drop into the pool directly off your room. This pool is only for those with off room lagoon access and those family rooms that have chosen the ‘level’ upgrade. Sometimes, the only down side was that rooms above saw this quiet pool below and decided that it was a great option for all their kids away from the main pools. Staff were ok about asking people, but also don’t want to upset anybody. Any issue though, they were quick to respond.  The ‘level’ access was also well worth the extra $$, especially
author: SpitzieAussie

comment: Melia is more senior than other nearby resorts, however it is very well maintained with an inviting reception, stunning grounds and freshly renovated rooms.  There is a family feel at Melia with the teams of staff all remembering your name and giving a friendly smile and wave every time you pass by.  The Level lounge helps the experience feel very special and easy !  I loved my welcome coconut printed with my name !  The healthy breakfast options a la carte were the best I’ve had!   Delicious. Really great Japanese restaurant as well that I visited twice! What I really enjoyed the most was the fusion of sports and wellness programs that were on offer.  These offered excellent value for money and really felt reinvigorated after some intense exercise and spa relaxation.  The young
author: Alan D

comment: I must say, I’m very pleased that my issue with my hotel room was resolved.  I had an issue with the noise last night at my former room that kept me awake all night.  I called the front desk to complain about it, and they quickly offered me a change of room, but the rest of my family was asleep so they sent someone to take me to a different room to sleep for the night.   The next day, when I woke up, the staff were already awake of my change of room but I wasn’t ready to re-pack my luggage right away.  During the night I called in to inquire for my change of room and they quickly took me to a different room to stay.  The staff was super nice, each and every single one one them and so apologetic of my first nights experience.  The guest relation officer was there to take care of
author: khristetah

comment: Location: Well located amongst the big hotel chains as they all share a long beach front. It tooks us 15-30 mins walk to get to local restaurants in the main area.   Reception: check-in was smooth and welcome drink was provided. Staff were proactive in assisting us with taking our bags to our rooms.   Food: We had breakfast at the hotel on the 3 nights we were there. It’s honestly the worst breakfast I have ever had in a 5 star hotel. Food was dry and didn’t look all that appetising. Getting the attention of staff to get tea topped up was difficult and I often had to leave my meal to go directly to staff to get their attention. We also had dinner at the Lotus where service again was below par; food was good but expensive what you get.   Room: The room was a decent size and was
author: goldbeauty

comment: My wife, son and I revisited the Melia Nusa Dua after 2 years absence (due to covid) and found it just as lovely as ever.  That said, there were a few concerning issues that we brought to the resorts attention and hope they will be addressed.  Foremost was the lack of standards around the pool. We saw guests eating and drinking while standing in the pool. We also observed a guest take their baby for a swim without a nappy. While nothing untoward occurred at the time, we couldn't help but think of the ramifications of people dropping their food in the pool or the baby reliving themselves in the pool. We had hoped that the pool staff might have intervened but they didn't, perhaps out of fear of offending the hard earned guests?  While on the beach, we saw staff diligently sweeping
author: Brad H

comment: This was our first trip to Bali.  I went with just my 22 year old son as a special getaway.  The family suite was perfect.  It had a bed and bathroom on the ground floor (two singles which they made up as one King Bed) and a King sized bed and bathroom on a mezzanine level.  The room was beautifully appointed and had all we need.  We chose to upgrade to be Level guests.  This was just perfect!  It meant the use of an exclusive Level pool and beach area.  For us travelling in the school holidays, the Level Pool did not have children in it and was quiet and peaceful as was the beach area.  The actual resort is so luxurious.  Huge and glorious gardens, great fitness amenities (we used the basketball court and gym daily), a lovely selection of restaurants.  I love that there is a
author: Helen N

comment: This was our third visit within a few months. We love staying at Melia Bali. The hotel is very well maintained, and they offer free non-motorized activities and bicycles. We always walked along the beach and observed other hotels and I think Melia is the most lively and well maintained at least among nearby hotels. One thing that was always outstanding is the hospitality by the hotel staffs. They're genuinely nice and provide their best service. Shoutouts to Ibu Sagung, Pak Karta at the breakfast El Patio restaurant who are very friendly, and also Pak Sumartha who checks around with the guests if everything is alright with their stay.  Dining in at the restaurants are quite pricey (as expected in 5-star hotels in Nusa Dua area), but if they lower the price a bit I think I will
author: Ezra P

comment: Checked out of the Melia tonight after spending the last 13 days there.  We stayed in a Level family suite which suited us as we had our 16 year old son with us so having separate sleeping areas was great.  The room was a tad tired and is need of modernising. Quite a few people have mentioned the bathrooms and the over the bath showers. Even though I’m quite short our son is a lot taller and he struggled with it.  The hotel itself is extremely well maintained and you always see staff busying themselves around.   What really stood out for us was the staff. They say that Thailand is the land of smiles but the Melia must run it a close second. Every time you walked past a member of staff they said hello and it seemed genuine.  We must however give a special mention to Pringga,
author: DeanoW70

comment: After waiting over 2 years to visit the Amelia Bali with friends we were not disappointed.  We arrived after a very long journey and were met with friendly smiling faces, a welcoming drink of a personalised coconut drink and a garland of flowers.  We stayed in a Level room and it was beautiful with views of the garden from our balcony.  Breakfast was served in the level Restsurant and had a good variety of food to satisfy everyone’s needs.   We were also able to visit the main breakfast buffet if we wished.  The restaurants we visited in the hotel had a good selection of food which was nice and hot, service was good.  The gardens at the hotel along with general areas were superb, very clean and welcoming.   Everyone was so pleasant and every day we were met with smiling faces
author: Jayne L

comment: We spent 7 days here as the second leg of a Singapore/Bali trip, couldn't be a more different location really. The entire immaculately maintained site is in an area of great natural beauty with lots of wildlife and still with excellent facilities from the 5 different restaurants to the spa, pools, beach, and various activities. So you can spend the day lazing or pop out on trips, or explore the surrounding area. We went as level guests and you definitely get to feel special, and also the separate lounge enabled us to quickly resolve any questions about pretty much anything. First advice to anything going, the evening meals, if you want anything other than Le Patio restaurant then book, we booked five days ahead with the staff help and it was well worth it, especially to secure
author: Robert A

comment: After reading the list of Covid safety protocols we felt we were coming to a hotel which took the risk of infection very seriously but we were wrong. We were checked in by someone without a mask which surprised and alarmed us but that was just the beginning. Only about 10-15% of staff wore masks and 1% of guests. After experiencing the lack of hygiene at the breakfast zoo we opted for room service which was very pleasant and arrived promptly. We noticed very few hand sanitising facilities around the restaurant areas. Not sure how often the lifts were sanitised. At our previous hotel the lifts were treated once every hour. An alarming number of guests had “juicy” coughs and colds but I guess that is to be expected with no precautions being taken. We have stayed at the Melia three
author: AnneAucklandNZ

comment: Beautiful resort with awesome staff, especially the level staff Darma, Arta and Pringga  who looked after us around the pool day after day. Nothing was ever a problem for them and they gave brilliant service.  Highly recommend getting the all inclusive package, as food and drinks are a bit pricey. This allows you to order food and drink anytime anywhere from any restaurant and bar and it’s included.  The resort is clean and the pool lagoon rooms are a great size with separate lounge and outdoor patio that leads directly into the pool.  Hope to stay again soon
author: Marlinscy

comment: My daughter and I stayed here for 4 nights in a lagoon access room. Positives: Stunningly beautiful grounds. The resort is immaculate and the scenery is truly amazing. The beach was lovely. We also loved the beach bar in the evenings which was lit up by lots of lights. The Santeria beach restaurant was by far the best and the trees offered welcome shade when dining during the day. The spa was lovely and we had relaxing and professional treatments there. There were lots of activities available throughout the day. Staff were friendly and hard working. Everyone tried their best and I appreciate their efforts. Room for improvement: We stayed all inclusive. We found the food to be quite limited in the Lotus restaurant and also the Sorrento restaurant. We were disappointed with our
author: TopCat

comment: It is a wonderful hotel in a beautiful setting with beach and swimming pools that exceeded our expectations. We had booked a Junior Suite - All Inclusive online with a spacious downstairs living room and an upstairs bedroom with bathrooms on each floor. Big rooms and bathrooms, all extremely clean and well taken care of. The All-Inclusive package allowed us to try out each of the restaurants and bars, savoring all their Western and Eastern delicacies. The buffet selection at breakfast is fantastic. Service is excellent, everybody very friendly and eager to help from the reception to the restaurants. Our special thanks go to Sumantha, the hotel’s guest relations officer (assuming this is his official title), who went out of his way to assist us in everything and not missing a
author: Tommy B

comment: We travelled as a couple in July 2022 spending 7 days at Melia Bali and have returned home today.  Melia Bali is designed for families or groups. Spending the day by the lovely pool was overshadowed by endless noise from busy and excitable children and loud music.  The resort gardens are wonderful, though I really did wish there was some place that was quiet to relax.  Our room was a two floor Junior Suite. It didn't receive much sun and the air conditioning would always default to freezing temperatures when we left for our days activities.   We escaped winter at home for the warmth of Indonesia and did not want to shiver each time we returned to our room. However, the room was very clean and spacious. author: DamoCanberra

comment: Chef bayu is an asset to the Melia nusa dua. Once he found out my partner was celiac he made a special effort to personally cater for us both every morning for breakfast. He would ask us the day before if there was any particular dish we would like to have made for us and then prepared the meals strictly avoiding any possible gluten contamination, even using dedicated pots and pans etc. He made our rice and noodles extra spicy the way we like it, even made us banana pancakes which were the best I have ever tasted! He was so lovely and accommodating. He genuinely cares and always went above and beyond to ensure every meal was a delight, yet so diligent as to not make him sick. Our overall stay was amazing. Would definitely stay here again.
author: Katie-Lee A

comment: We spent 2 weeks in Meliá Bali and it was the best two weeks in our life. The hotel service was excellent, we had only breakfast but there were a great number of choices which we could eat from. The fascilities were also very great. The most suprising thing was that the hotel crew was really really nice, always smiling. The room service like cleaning and maintaning was very profound, especially our cleaning lady, Desak, who always did a very prominent job. We are very thankful for her and the whole hotel stuff.
author: Blanka T

comment: We are actually still staying in the hotel until Saturday, we where supposed to be booked in for 10 days and changed it to 5, thank god we did.   Also want to explain there are many nice areas of the hotel including the grounds and our pool access room.   The staff are also very attentive, always polite but can be very very slow during service.   The food in the hotel is seriously below average, lunch menus in beach restaurant and main restaurant is the same as the dinner menu and does not change.   Food often arrives cold, my ‘wagyu’ steak in the tapas restaurant was something Ive never witnessed or tasted before, disgraceful.   Drinks are served with no ice frequently which for a 5 star hotel is a disgrace.   Octopus in the beach restaurant was served Luke warm, I didn’t know
author: Ryan W

comment: we (my wife, our 17 years old son and me) spend 7 awesome days at the Melia Bali Resort in Nusa Dua as part of our family holiday in Bali  (4 days in Sigapore, 5 days at the Payogan Villa Resort and Spa in Ubud and 7 days at the Melia Bali Resort). To give our son some privacy we booked one of the LEVEL family suites with connecting doors. These suites consist of two separate rooms with a connecting door. The "parents" room has a huge living room, a bedroom and two bathrooms (one with and one without a shower).  The other room has a bedroom and a bathroom.   The LEVEL upgrade has a lot of benefits and is really worth it.  There is a separate breakfast room where you can get a la card meals (you have to try the Melia Pink Fruit Bowl),  a private part of the beach with kabanas and
author: Peter S

comment: We stayed at the Melia for New Years Eve (in 2 rooms) and while there was lots to love, there were also a few areas where we were not fully satisfied. The large, well manicured property itself is gorgeous and there are many activities - paddle boarding, badminton, kidzone etc - available, most for free and some at a small cost. Because the property is so large, even though the hotel was teeming with guests for New Year's there were no issues with crowding and the atmosphere was very pleasant and felt covid-safe. The hotel was very festive, with delightful Xmas decorations and a New Years meal and other events on offer. The location beach side is lovely, the lobby fabulous and the rooms well designed with balconies etc.   There were 2 particular problems during our stay. One was
author: Jacqueline W

comment: We went to Melia Bali in September.  We were in a deluxe room and upgraded to the Level. We are so glad we did this as we were able to access the adult pool and a different breakfast area.  We also upgraded to all inclusive. Which was the best thing we did. There are a lot of restaurants and bars that have closed around the area due to Covid. I hope they open up soon.  The all inclusive allowed us to have a choice of 5 restaurants which were all good and drinks. Room service was great where we could order anything 24 hours a day. The package also included daily bike hire, paddle boarding, kayaking and a discount for the Spa. We found it cheaper to upgrade to all inclusive directly with the hotel rather than with the tour operator.   The rooms are getting a bit dated hence my
author: Min Bonugli

comment: We travelled from England and arrived without issue approx 10pm. Having paid for "The Level" access, we were whisked off to a separate air cooled lounge, where TL staff took personal care of our check in and explained the facilities.   We had also chosen to go all inclusive, meaning that we had free use of the 4 different restaurants catering for different themes, along with the pool bars and coffee shops.   This is not a typical AYCE all inclusive buffet. Food orders are freshly cooked and of a high quality in restaurants like Sorrento.  Theres also an Indonesian music and dance show in the Lotus restaurant which serves Asian cuisine.  Wide selection of beverages, but the AI only covers basic spirits like local beer, gin, vodka, whisky not non-Indonesian brands like Campari or
author: Nick T

comment: The overall experience was fantastic. All 10 of my family had a great time. We had 5 rooms and each was cleaned and stocked up each day by very efficient and helpful staff. We were particularly impressed with our room service guy Boyu Wiguna as he was always smiling and very helpful. Would recommend The Melia Bali to coupes, family and friends. The Christmas and New year decorations and celebrations were great.
author: HMR1945

comment: We chose the Melia in Bali as we were impressed when staying at the Melia in Berlin.  We were not disappointed.  We chose the Level package and really pleased that we did.  The service was fantastic and the staff superb.  The Level exclusive pool was a real relaxing experience as it was of a good size and really quiet. We had a ground floor pool access junior suite and it was great.  We went on a B & B package which allowed us to eat locally at restaurants and warungs within walking distance.   The only downside of being in the Nusa Dua areas was that it took ages to get to see the main tourist attractions due to the traffic.  In particular Yudi, in the Level lounge, and Darma, at the Level pool, were superb and really made out holiday special.  They were so professional,
author: hdh175

comment: Unfortunately the biggest regret of our holiday! Meliá is supposed to be a five star hotel, naturally you would have certain expectations. The entrance to hotel is beautiful, the staff are welcoming but unfortunately the 5 star aspect ends there. Once we arrived to our room we were underwhelmed! The rooms are tiny and have no luxury aspect. Our shower was built into the bath and when I stood in the bath my head would touch the plastic cladded ceiling and shower would only just reach my shoulder.. I’m 6ft. Additionally the tiles had filler repairs all over them, hardly a pleasant or tranquil site. author: Ben A

comment: We stayed at the Melia Bali for 11 nights, we had booked for the Level Lagoon access suite. On Arrival we were taken to the Level lounge where we greeted by Yudi who is a very enthusiastic and knowledgeable young man. He gave us both personalised coconuts which was very refreshing, also a lei garland. Whilst there we enquired how much it would cost to upgrade to a Level Garden Villa. He then showed us 2 that were available for the duration and we decided on Villa 3. On entering we were blown away by how lovely and luxurious it was. The villa is set in its own private walled garden with its own pool and Khoi pond.  The villa it’s self is very large with 3 main areas, Bedroom, his and hers wardrobe space, and bathroom with huge Roman bath and walk in shower as well as an out door
author: Kittycats5767

comment: My wife and I have just departed from Melia Bali following a two week stay for our honeymoon and we couldn’t be sadder to be leaving.  Following a gruelling 16 hours of flying and a hectic airport experience upon arrival in Bali we were both tired, fed up and really wanting nothing more than to go to sleep. However, the moment we stepped out of the car and we’re greeted by the welcoming and friendly faces of the Melia staff all that changed.   We upgraded our stay to include the level access which came with access to a smaller and more personal check in process, which included a cold refreshing drink and a tremendous level of service from Yudi who checked us in and took us to our room.   From the moment we arrived until the moment we left we found that every single member of
author: Matt T

comment: I chose Melia for my holidays mainly because of the variety of the sports activities they offer compared to other resorts in the area. The quality of the classes and activities was high and the gym very well-equipped. My overall experience there was amazing because of its people/staff that was extremely customer-centric, attentive and friendly. I will definitely go back and also recommend this hotel to others just because of its kind people and the warm atmosphere they create for the visitors. I could tell that they weren't just doing their job, they really cared to make my stay a unique one.   Specifically Ian was a standout. author: Maria

comment: Pros: beautiful old hotel with amazing gardens, ponds. Clean rooms with comfy beds, spacious terraces and outstanding front desk/congierge staff. Cons: the breakfast and the pool. We arrived at the breakfast restaurant at 10 AM. It was full (it is a big group at the hotel) it was really hard to find a clean table, the crowd was enormous. You can order you omelette/fried egg  (after several people will join the line in front of you) and a nice  lady will take your order with your room number and you can go back to pick it up. Our omelette was’t ready even after 20 minutes so I cancelled our order and we tried to eat something else. We have barely found any bread, fruit, jam, almost everything was “robbed”. The orange juice is a joke. The guests doesn’t respect at all COVID safety
author: LKitty

comment: Well, after an enforced 2 and a half year absence it was great to enter this wonderful Hotel once more. As usual, we were made very welcome and our Romance Suite was perfect. We enjoyed the rest, food, Yhi Spa, and the wonderful grounds. The addition of  free roaming ducks is charming. We were also impressed by the expansion of the vegetable gardens and the supply of fresh eggs from the new chickens. The staff, as usual, were very cheerful, hard working and attentive. As we spent most of our time relaxing at the Level pool I will mention the exceptional  care given by the pool boys ( Led by the legend..Yan Sarden..!) the names we remember (sorry if we forgot anyone) are; Darma, Pringga, Arta, Angga and Juli. Again, apologies to those whose names we cant remember. Our evenings
author: rayricho

comment: Melia is great for families. Travelling with husband, 3yo and 10 month old we booked a family room. My daughter loved the princess bed in the loft. Kids club were very welcoming however unable to leave kids under 4 there but that didn’t bother me. The breakfast OMG I have never seen so much delicious  food in my life.  Only down side is on two occasions there were no clean pool towels available. Lots of sun lounges avail around the pool but good luck getting a sun bed. The beach also didn’t have many sun lounges avail unless u were a VIP member. Also the pressure in the shower was shocking. I am not one to complain but the water was just dribbling out. We stayed in a 3 star hotel prior in Legian and it has 10 times better water pressure. There is also not many cheap places to
author: washa24

comment: A great hotel, lots of amenities but the rooms are slightly outdated. It's a busy hotel with a lot of Australian families, but there is plenty of space. The buffet breakfast was excellent and although it was extremely busy at peak times, there was always a table somewhere and the staff were very helpful clearing and cleaning.  Dinner at the beachfront restaurant was delightful, well prepared and very tasty.  The hotel is a safe 15 minute walk to other bars and restaurants in Nusa Dua which were also nice and very friendly.
author: RJL57

comment: Just returned from 12 nights at the Melia Bali. It has been an amazing holiday, we’ve loved seeing as much of the island as possible and the hotel resort was always a lovely place to return to.  Considering it’s only been open post Covid  for about 3 months, they are doing really well. The staff are outstanding, the grounds are stunning, pool and beach are wonderful. We weren’t all inclusive so just had breakfast included, it was delicious with choices from pastries to curries to Indonesian classics, full English, every type of egg, cereals, fruit (a little tasteless), pancakes even a chocolate fountain! The juice is a bit watered down and coffee offered is average, but you can order cappuccino which was nicer. The coffee served at the coffee shop by the beach is amazing. It is
author: Melanie F

comment: From the moment we stepped in the building we where treated like royalty, staff couldn't do enough for us.  The food is fantastic, lots of places to eat, from beach from bars to romantic restaurants all on the complex.  Waiter staff where beyond helpful and the most polite for us was Bege. Always polite always kept us topped up and loved a friendly chat but wasn't pushy or intrusive.  Couple of tips. Bali is beyond humid, so ask for a dehumidifier in your room. You'll empty it around 4 times a day but it makes the room experience a lot better.  Get the 'cabrio west' excision where you travel NW to a temple in an open top 1970s VW car (vw thingy.. Yes 'thingy') and you'll take in what bali culture really is and see some amazing sights. Be warned you set off at 8am and get back
author: Darren Wilson

comment: First time we have stayed in a villa at this resort, also the first time we have made use of The Level facilities, I highly recommend that you do both.  We have stayed in the family room a couple of times previously and this is good up to two children, you do get a bit of privacy as the main room is on the upper level of a studio apartment. The hotel itself is exceptional, the grounds. pools, the food and the staff. We have stayed at a couple of different hotels on this tourist section of Nusa Dua and the Melia is by far the better one for us. As an added bonus, if you become a Melia Rewards member and work your way up. there are some good discounts to be had..... If you want to eat outside of the hotel, lots of local restaurants that will pick you up and drop you off for free.
author: Mark C

comment: Lovely place to stay, with fantastic amenities and in a good location. Some nice activities to do. It is very expensive for what it is and the rooms are quite outdated and small relative to other places we stayed at. The restaurant, bar and spa are really overpriced in my opinion. We stayed at places with much nicer rooms, for much cheaper. I think this is partly because of the area that it's in, but we ate out for almost every meal because other places were so much cheaper (even some close by).
author: Sam S

comment: Went to Nusa Dua as quieter with wider streets and well maintained infastructure. Stayed at Melia Resort and booked a junior suite, however upgraded to a villa at expense as junior suite was dark, dated and had limited space. It was two levels with a steep stair case to the bedroom. The consierge were helpful when we requested the upgrade and the villa was spacious with private pool and courtyard. The villa was well serviced and included level 1 access allowing ala carte breakfast, cocktails and canapes at night and access to better beach front and pool. The staff on the whole were friendly and attentive. Breakfast was good, but otherwise meals were expensive and only adequate so we ate out at the plentiful local restaurants. I would go back again but only book the more
author: Plucka

comment: We have just returned from 6 nights all inclusive at Melia Bali with our family of 5 (kids aged 8,10,12) and had a great time. Whilst I tend to agree with other reviews that the resort is slightly aged and family rooms dark, this was 100% made up by the staff who were kind, friendly and went over and above their jobs. This was especially the case at the kids club and activity centre where the staff were exceptional. Alep in particular was so kind to our children by playing with them, taking them to the futsal and basketball courts and off for bike rides - they formed a beautiful friendship that I know our kids will treasure.   Food was ok - we liked the beachside restaurant the best and I would advise to go all inclusive as it was quite pricey (although comparable to other
author: Emma R

We stayed at Melia twice  in october 2021. The first visit when we were about to  check in, they asked for us to pay almost IDR 200k per photographer as additional charges for our photo sessions. And after a long debate with management, they agreed to waive the additional cost.  Couple of Weeks later, we stayed for the second time to used our remaining vouchers  And when we were about to check in,  they asked for  additional charge around more than IDR 1 mio per photographer. comment: We visited The Melia back in May/June 2019 for our Honeymoon (apologies for the late review). We arrived mid afternoon, and as our car pulled into the palm lined driveway it felt welcoming and serene. Balinese music was being played by two musicians in the entrance and we were guided towards the air-conditioned level lounge to check in. We were provided with a list of drinks to select and cold towels. A receptionist then sat down with us and explained the package we had bought and what was included, and showed us the map, he offered to book us dinner for that evening. We were feeling quite overwhelmed after a very long journey and although the receptionist had offered to give us a tour of the resort, we politely declined, both desperate to have a lay down, we were taken to our
author: Belu

comment: Being our first time to Bali (with two kids aged 8 and 5) we opted for the Melia Bali and boy was it worth it !  From the exceptionally friendly staff to the excellent facilities (variety of restaurants, activities and a super friendly front desk / concierge to organise transfers).  We stayed in a Family Suite, having also thought about the idea of getting a Lagoon Room but the Family Suite is a better option with kids in my opinion.  Pool area was great (and safe!), kids could run around and use the go-karting and cycling facilities as well as the kids club with little supervision.  The restaurants are excellent ... we tried Lotus (Asian), Sorrento (Spanish, fantastic) and also Sateria, the beach restaurant .. all top quality.  The room itself was very spacious and extremely
author: Chris F

comment: Whilst most resort Hotels in the Nusa Duo area were at very low occupancy rates, the Melia enjoyed about 80 % to 90% capacity. Service level remained, as has been the case on our stay 2018, 2019 , and on our first revisit after a 2 year COVID gap,at the hightest level Reception Staff, Bars & Restaurant service personnel, were always polite, friendly, but above all MOST competent to ensure maximum enjoyment. When our Jetstar flight was cancelled, the administration tried unsuccessfully to make contact with the JetStar airport office, the Bali & then the Jakata Jetstar.  No contact could be made with their Consumer Service except to offer a useless instruction [not to contact on Saturday, the original date of the cancelled flight] but on Monday two days later.
