author: mcarr6

comment: My wife, Marie, and I stayed at the Melia Resort mid January 2020 and enjoyed our time there immensely. The ambiance of the hotel reflects the importance and respect the hotel has for its Balinese heritage and culture.  They have successfully combined the traditions of the region with a genuine touch of luxury. The staff obviously all take great pride in all their work from the warm welcome at reception to the gardening and maintenance teams.  If you haven’t received at least 100 Good Mornings with bright smiles by mid-day it’s because you haven’t left your room! Accommodation options are extensive from nice to luxuriant offered through many different levels. Melia has a good sized lagoon, a children’s pool and a private pool for “The Level” guests.  The resort has a private
author: Mark R

comment: Melia Bali is a beautiful hotel in a perfect location. The beach is calm and great for kids, as is the pool. There’s plenty of shallow areas for younger kids to play but also enough deeper areas for older kids and adults. I loved the daily aqua stretching and aqua aerobics. The kids club was also a standout. Tya, Dani, Aci, Sasih, Dewi, Glaney and Maria are amazing. They remember every child’s name and create a welcoming, safe and fun environment full of enriching activities that keep the kids engaged. The nightly marshmallow roasting on the beach and movie was a favourite for our kids.
author: Sara

comment: Really enjoyed the stay at Melia Bali! Super chill environment, you can choose where to relax around the resort: at the beach, the pool, in the hotel lobby, in the room. It's a great place to just switch off and do absolutely nothing!   The staff are super nice, pleasant, always smiling and will greet you when you walk by. When you first arrive at the resort, they will sound a gong to welcome you. They will even give you a welcome juice when you're checking in at the reception!   At breakfast time, there will be someone playing the gamelan outside the coffee house, in the evening, there's a pianist who will play the piano at the lobby. So you generally feel very relaxed, chill and safe.   The general environment is clean but could be better as it is a big place and pockets do
author: Grimsg

comment: We stayed in room 313 (Lagoon Access room) on the ground floor. Our room has direct access to the Lagoon pool and also a small private deck with 2 sunbeds.   The Lagoon pool is very clean and is approximately 100 metres in length, suitable for swimming laps if you wish!  We were warmly greeted by Miss Dayude from the Entertainment section of the hotel. Miss Dayude gave us a tour of the resort, explaining the various activities available at the hotel, many of which are free of charge.  She highlighted the live band playing at the Sateria Beachside Restaurant, which we did check out when we had drinks at the Beachside Restaurant.   The live band was awesome and the ambience was very relaxing and pleasant. The live band played until 9.30 pm.
author: EdSydney1

comment: This is a family oriented hotel with good facilities. Beautiful maintained grounds, very clean. The hotel lacked evening atmosphere in the bar or outside bar. A bit of live music wouldn’t go a miss. The hotel sits on a complex of hotels and you are a captive market, drinks were an extortionate price and whilst I realise it’s a hotel and they are always marked up, add to this the tax and service charge they were three times the price what you could get in a local restaurant. Staff were slow to serve if they weren’t being tipped in the beach bar.  If you choose to stay here use the local bars and restaurants outside the complex also to the right of the beach at the end of the path there are a few beach bars where you can enjoy friendly hospitality, good cheap Bali food and drink
author: Anne

comment: My husband and I visited this glorious hotel in June for six nights and wow was it amazing!  Spotlessly clean, incredible service, brilliant facilities and amazing restaurants!  We were very glad we opted for all inclusive as for Bali the food & drink prices weren’t cheap. Having such a fab choice of different restaurants to eat at was great and we loved how only the breakfast was buffet.  The pool area is so nice and we never once struggled to get a sunbed. The beach is lovely and it’s fab how you can walk along the beachfront through other hotels and get a decent 5km walk.  As I’ve left it a while to write this review I feel awful I can’t remember anyones names but really the staff make this hotel. Special shout out in particular to the staff at the Indonesian, the Spanish
author: Katiews

comment: We glad that we end our 2 weeks vacation in Bali by staying at Melia. It was our best stay and beyond perfect. I see they have done some nice renovation to the hotel facilities. We love the new look of the beachside restaurant and the outdoor kids club.   There are so many activities to keep our family busy around the resort. There're bike rental (free for the first hour!), kayak, parasailing, snorkeling, etc. The kiddy pool section is quite large. The beach is an enclaved bay, safe for toddlers. Our kids also thrilled that the staff arrange afternoon bonfire by the beach to make some shmores.  Staff were wonderful and attentive. Excellent implementation of the health protocol made us feel safe. House keeping/room make up only provided by request, in which the staff sanitize the
author: Huika

comment: I had high expectations for this hotel and I love the Melia group hotels. The service was really poor, could wait up to an hour for a can coke or sprite, food could take over hour, so make sure you are not hungry when you order. My food at the restaurant was never hot, I got quite Sick and got Bali belly. With stayed in the Level junior suite and the room is dated and need some upgrading. The bathroom you nearly break your neck getting out of the bath when you have had a shower, towels was old and fraying. His and miss if the mini bar was replenish or the toiletries in the bathroom. Room service dished was not cleared and could be in the room for days. A used coffee cup was not taken away. The bathroom sink has a bad smell coming out of it. Reported it and was sorted out. The
author: Jacqui D

comment: We have just spent an enjoyable relaxing stay at the resort. We booked the Family Suite Duplex, and the LEVEL Experience. We would really recommend LEVEL if you are seeking a more peaceful and sophisticated stay. From the front desk, to the breakfast  at the Sorrento restaurant, to the private beach experience with gazebos, and to the pool experience, all the staff was committed to deliver proactively the best experience. The hotel cleanliness and setup is high standard, and you will live in a very green environment, fully connected with nature. The food is superb (I guess by the quality of the ingredients used), especially the european style bakeries, the pizzas, the coffees, without forgetting the quality of the fruits at that time of the season. The atmosphere created by the
author: Hervé

comment: Great stay at Melia. Superb facilities, beautiful pool area and gardens. Nice kids club, several choices for restaurants although quite pricey vs local restaurants outside the resort. Your restaurant bill will be high if you have all your meals at the resort. The beach is nice but due to high/low tide there are some hours during the day when swimming is not really possible. Beach and water were very clean. It's worth to upgrade to LEVEL package if you want to enjoy adult only pool, fancier breakfast, tea time and cocktail hour. The resort was built in the 80's and has a great location on Nusa Dua beach. The age is felt in the living quarters and rooms are not really 5 stars, but the grounds and facilities/beach make up for it. Overall highly recommended.
author: Fransmeister

comment: Many tourists think it’s all normal, but for us was the housekeeping in this hotel of our room so special. And we travel a lot. Special thanks to Veren from housekeeping for her commitmend day after day.  The hotel is the perfect place to relax and to be served with a big smile everyday…you feel like a queen.  One thing … the money value is very high for eating and drinking in restaurant if you have no all inclusive.
author: Davy

comment: We chose Melia Bali as we have stayed in other Melia hotels in the past. We were not disappointed, in fact this Hotel rates in our top two, throughout our extensive travel history.  From the instant we arrived at the foyer, we were greeted with constant smiles and exceptional service.  We opted for a lagoon access room with the level benefits, on an all inclusive basis. For a 14 night holiday AI and the Level upgrade is definitely worth it, as prices for food & drink can be expensive. We checked in at The Level reception, a great experience, air conditioned (33deg outside), glass of bubbly and a detailed explanation of all the benefits and hotel layout, by Yudi, who is a credit to the Hotel and their staff training programme.  The level lounge also provides a base for Level
author: Copacabanakid5

comment: Meliá is one of my favourite resorts in Indonesia. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in “the level garden villa”. A 450sqm private villa with a garden, private pool, outdoor dining area, outdoor and indoor showers and baths, sun loungers, fish pond as well as ample space indoors! The villa is just moments walk from the beach and the level pool, where you also have reserved cabanas and sun loungers exclusively for the level guests over the age of 18 (so it’s really peaceful). It’s certainly worth opting for the all inclusive package as this includes mostly all cocktails, spirits, wine and beer as well as most food options across the 5 restaurant choices. Amazingly, it also includes unlimited room service drinks and food! AI is an absolute must to make the most of your stay and feel
author: RKK1

comment: The Welcome we received was like royalty and our stay we were treated like royalty every day. The food was amazing but we found been bed and breakfast the little place around the corner was more Balinese than the hotel was and a lot cheaper three course meal with drinks £24 for two people. The pool was fantastic have to mention Haryadi he is a credit to this hotel he is so attentive and polite always willing to go the extra mile. The food and drinks manager Dewai is very polite and will do anything for you. The breakfast choice is fantastic and caters for all must mention David always welcomes you with a smile always happy to do anything for you. Always asks if you were happy with your breakfast and always looks to see if you need a refill of coffee and tea . Overall the
author: Antstoke

comment: Stayed for two weeks to escape the winter , never stayed at a Meliá before and like all 5star hotels your not always sure wether they got the 5 stars for facilities or service it’s not normally both , this place is amazing , I’ve been travelling my whole life , worldwide and this place has got to be the best ever , I’d like to name the staff members who have stood out but I can’t name one individual as they’ve all exceeded my expectations , not one bad experience , the hotel itself is beautifully kept and the rooms cleaned to a near perfect standard , beach area and pools immaculate , food was amazing and I’m not a foody .   Tide can make swimming from the beach a tad awkward as a ya quite shallow but ideal for kids but some of the best beaches in Bali are only a 15 minute walk
author: longlance

comment: We have just returned from the Melia Bali and wow what a hotel. We had booked the level junior suites and had all inclusive which i would recommend. The service with the Level upgrade is second to none.   We arrived at the hotel to be taken to the bar area (not reception, as we had the level) and were greeted by Yudi. He dealt with our check in for us whilst getting us a personalised coconut refreshing drink then drinks from the bar. He then checked our rooms were ready and took us to our rooms. We were a party of 6 adults and had 3 rooms all next door to each other. The level junior suites were fantastic.   We ate in all the restaurants and all were excellent for quality and service. The bars were all excellent. We never used the level pool as there aren't many beds round there
author: Lee C

comment: My husband and I have been staying at the Melia hotel in Bali for the 4th week. the first two weeks we were here with our daughters' families. Thanks to the excellent staff, both in Level security under the leadership of Mr. Ydi, the beach staff without exception, and especially good food and good service in all the restaurants under the leadership of Mr. Dewi, we spent a wonderful time here. We will definitely be happy to come back here. I only have a comment about the quality of cleaning in the rooms and also about the equipment of the rooms within the Level
author: Milan V

comment: We had the all inclusive package which is a good deal considering the food and drink prices are expensive.  The only thing is after 10 days the food becomes a bit boring. but they do have a very good taxi service on site at reasonable prices if you want to travel around, we went to legion for a day it cost about A$8.00 each way.
author: Dennis R

comment: Melia is our new home away from home!  We have had the pleasure of staying in a Villa as well as a Family Suite and both are great.  Book the all inclusive, level access to get the most of our holiday which means food, drinks, mini bar and poolside snacks for the kids are all take care of.  The location is fantastic, the rooms are clean, the beach is stunning, the staff are friendly, the food and drink options are a plenty! Drop the kids at kids club and head to the tranquil adult’s only pool or to the spa. There are daily activities - yoga, Pilates, volleyball etc as well as classes in the pool and a great walking path that runs for kms up and down the Nusa Dua coast.   Dining wise you have many options all of which are great. There’s Lotus for authentic Asian Cuisine with Indo
author: JC

comment: Today we are at Meliá Bali Indonesia for the Daycation package. It is a large resort with a lot of kids running around, peddling bikes and screaming kids in the pool. So for families it would be a great resort, but not for couples. No Bintang available here, cheapest beer is 49,000 ++ 250ml coke 47,000++  Buffet breakfast 180,000++ Jim Beam & Coke 147,000++ plus the coke 47,000++  Cocktails were average 158,000++ Club sandwich 157,000 ++ Note ++ is 21%  We wanted to see what this resort was like as we were thinking of staying here next year. Unfortunately this place is not for us. #meliabali #nusaduabali #notidealforcouples Holiday dreaming inc
author: wardybali

comment: Stayed for 6 nights, all inclusive package in connecting rooms with lagoon access.   Rooms The connecting rooms are perfect for a family, the kids can go to bed and the parents still have plenty of space to relax. Also, the direct access to the pool meant one of us could easily have a swim while our youngest had her day sleeps. Decor is a little dated but still perfectly clean and comfortable.   All Inclusive  The all inclusive is worthwhile, particularly if you want to have coffees from the coffee shop in the morning, cocktails during the day and smoothies for the kids, snacks from the minibar etc - all that adds up.   Restaurants  The breakfast is very good at El Patio, they have every cuisine, including really nice croissants, eggs cooked fresh, Indonesian, Indian. There is
author: Will8377

comment: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Melia. The grounds are absolutely beautiful and the service was exceptional. The pool was so warm and relaxing (the levels exclusive pool), never an issue to find a sun lounge and  very attentive service. The breakfast for levels benefit was also  so appreciated with a la carte options and much more tranquil. I would definitely recommend the levels benefits if traveling without children. The rooms were a little bit dated and  dark ,and the dining options for dinner were a little disappointing for  variety for 5 star standard after a couple of days. But there are other options for dining so close at hand. We spent one day in a cabana by the beach where we were also very looked after by the wonderful staff. Nusa Dua and Melia was a fantastic
author: Annette-marlowe

comment: Melia Bali is a beautiful but expensive resort. We enjoyed our time here thoroughly. It is a very family friendly resort. The beach, the bars and the pool were gorgeous and the included breakfast was so plentiful, heaps to chose from. A must to get breakfast included. The rooms were really cool which gave us respite from the heat. The only draw backs were: 1.  The pool was closed at 7pm, which was a shame as we wanted to be able to cool off after a night out.  2. And of course the meals and drinks were expensive (compared to the other places we had visited in Seminyak & Ubud) - we ended up buying drinks outside the resort and brining them back to our room and just grabbed a couple to drink  sitting around the pool.  3. Laundry - do not get your washing done here. We were charged
author: Joyline R

comment: Stayed at the Melia in Bali for 6 days. Had booked all inclusive as was told that if I spoke to the staff they would cook extra vegetarian things. This did not happen. I spoke to the staff when I went into restaurants daily but they just pointed to the menu.  There was no attempt to do anything extra as promised. There was usually just one or two vegetarian options. I survived on pizza and pasta for 6 days.  The pizzas were nice though but pasta okay.  The room was looking tired and this is despite me booking an upgrade.  When I asked for a late checkout they wanted to charge me $15 per hour and this is despite me pointing out about the food.  The only salvation for the hotel is how lovely all the other staff were. This compared to staff in India and Mauritius in terms of their
author: Sam P

comment: Absolutely amazing resort!  We spent 5 nights in this resort during Xmas and had such a wonderful time we already planning our next visit.   The resort is huge, rooms are clean and very good size.  We stayed in the Level lagoon access room, we have 3 ppl, the room has one king size bed and a sofa bed.  The sofa bed converted to a twin bed and is comfortable.   Plenty of sitting areas around the property and the pools.  We selected the all inclusive plan which was the best decision, food were abundance and delicious, the plan even included most alcoholic drinks,  the Sakura Japanese restaurant has some of the most delicious Japanese dishes.  Since we spent the Xmas there they have included a special Christmas Eve dinner and a Christmas Day brunch, which we enjoyed very much.
author: Heidi L

comment: We are very grateful for the hospitality and good service during our stay at the Melia Bali Nusa Dua hotel.  Without realizing it, we stayed for 1 month very comfortably in a lagoon type room where the room was very clean and the facilities in the room were complete.  A special thanks to Mrs. Putu Laba, Mrs.Yuni, Mr.I Wayan Doni W., Mr. Sumiartha, Mr. Dewa, Mr. Hendra, Mrs. Sagung, Mr. Sumerta/Sarden, Mr. Agung, Mrs. Putu and all the staff at the restaurant who have provided us with excellent and friendly service.  And also Chef Nyoman and Chef Made who have served delicious foods.
author: Benyamin Ramli

comment: Large hotel in Nusa Dua frequented by lots of young families. Great amenities with multiple pools, clean beach (lots of effort from beach sweepers), great kids club, golf simulator, gym, multiple pools etc. Option of standard rooms or Level which allows access to a seperate less crowded non-child pool (i.e. >12 yr olds only), seperate section to the breakfast buffet (table service, better presented meals, always a table available), 2 hours of daily included cocktails (best bar in the hotel) There’s also an all inclusive option which we didn’t try so keep our options open to explore the area and our kids aren’t big eaters.  The kids club were great with good feedback from all the kids we saw. Evening movies and roasted marshmallows were a hit. The gym was well equipped. The
author: goony51

comment: An exceptional resort. Definitely spend the extra and go The Level and all-inclusive. The Level pool alone makes this option worth it. It’s uncrowded, kid-free with heaps of service staff. You never wait long for food and drinks. Nightly cocktails in the Level bar also a highlight. The Restaurants are mostly very good, with the Japanese restaurant Sakura being the best. Outstanding sushi, sashimi and tempura. Tepanyaki is not included within the package but is affordable if you’re prepared to spend the extra. The Spanish restaurant Sorrento was the only blemish. The seafood paella missed the mark and is not what you would expect from a decent Spanish restaurant. But that was the only hiccup in a week long stay.  If you like your food and drinks, then you will come out well in
author: Simon M

comment: I had the pleasure of staying 8 nights here. My friend and I bought the all inclusive package to celebrate her birthday and we loved this resort! The pictures don’t do it justice!! It’s beautiful, the food is great, the resort is very clean and most importantly the staff is amazing! They have activities daily for the guests to check out, my friend and I did yoga and met Agus the instructor who was lovely and happened to be our tour guide that same night at the Uluwatu  temple in which the resort includes transportation to. Agus and Soma were our tour guides for the temple and on the bus ride there and back they had me laughing and smiling non stop with their humor and singing. it was quite the experience, our whole group loved them!! The resort also had 4 restaurants to chose
author: Maryssa C

comment: Returning after covid this year for Xmas & New Year. Last time visited was 2019 & Meliá is now getting back open in earnest. Mix of experienced and new staff make the service & experience a little hit & miss….familiar faces in breakfast & the Level pool are a welcome sight….Nesti is amazing & attentive….she is a credit & real asset to the hotel. One thing about the Level pool that needs sorting urgently is people using the facilities that haven’t paid for them - I suggest putting one of the uniformed guards there as you do on the beach…..annoying that people have the arrogance to just rock up and use the facilities without even being Level guests…..then argue with the young staff that they want to stay….! Tried most of the restaurant facilities and menus have changed since 2019
author: David P

comment: Amazing stay.  Beautiful grounds, so relaxed minute you walk in.  Staff are incredible and so welcoming. No request was too hard.  They bought milk to my room for baby and offered to heat it up.  At dinners we could request anything for the kids pretty much and they sorted it.  Food was amazing especially the Mutton Curry at Lotus restaurant.  Kids club was great! Special Shout out to April Haseline staff member at the coffee shop whom took a real shining to our toddlers and made them feel very special.  She also made fantastic coffee.   Spa treatment (hour long massage) was best massage I've ever had - also got to use the outdoor hottub and the massage was done on such a comfy bed!  Room service was incredbile - never waited more than 20 mins for everything Epitomy of service
author: Jennifer T

comment: My friend and I visited in Bali, Indonesia and stayed at Melia Bali resort. It was the first time we stayed and it won’t be the last. Service and hospitality within the resort was excellent. Start your day with some stretching and yoga with Agus. Make sure your stay includes  all inclusive and take advantage of the complementary trip to Uluwatu temple with Soma and his ukelele. He can sing songs ranging from Bruno Mars to Elvis Presley. And for intense and physical workouts, sign up sessions with Adrian.  Everything you could think you need, Melia Bali and her staff will try their best to accommodate. Overall, it was a memorable experience with excellent service from all the staff.
author: Gherly A

comment: Our family has such an amazing time at Melia Bali. I highly recommend getting the all inclusive package if you go, as it is totally worth your money in what you receive. The amenities, rooms, food and hospitality are all 5 star in our eyes. We had the most amazing time doing all the activities that Melia has to offer— shout out to Agus who went above and beyond in giving us such a good time when it came to yoga, bike tours, water aerobics and cultural activities. Ian was amazing as well. They bring such an amazing and fun energy to the resort that wouldn’t be the same without them.
author: Kayla P

comment: We had a great stay at Melia. Family of 4 with young kids, heaps to do for them with great kids activities and pool.   We did all inclusive which was good.   Main complaint being the rooms are a bit tired with small maintenance issues. I accept this as the hotel has been basically closed for 2 years so I will expect things to start being resolved now it is getting back to full capacity.   Staff are great and grounds are beautiful.  Sateria restaurant on the beach was great at night with beach fire for the kids, live music and dancing and different buffet dinners.   I would return again
author: Sam S

comment: My family are just back from an amazing holiday in Bali. The first week we stayed in the Melia Bali and it was fantastic. The hotel was beautiful with large garden area that lead to the pool and down onto the beach.  It had everything, great food, lovely rooms, amazing pool and beach but the thing that makes the Melia Bali so special was the staff. They were so welcoming and always to the extra mile to make sure you are happy. We have a 3 year old son and 7 month old daughter and they both loved it. The staff were always checked they were comfortable and not too hot.   Special mention to some of the amazing staff that will be friends forever.   SARDEN, looked after us ever day at the pool, our little girl wasn’t well a couple of days and he always tried to make sure we had
author: Graeme Lee

comment: We had five wonderful nights here as a couple without children in a Junior Lagoon Access Room.  Pros: Super friendly staff who absolutely cannot do enough to help you. Lovely food in all the restaurants and cocktails  - we were All Inclusive. The grounds were beautifully maintained. The yoga in the mornings was perfect and my husband was impressed with the equipment in the gym. Our Lagoon Pool Room was wonderful - huge bathroom, our own little deck and lagoon pool access made us feel very spoiled. The hotel is located in Nusa Dua  so a great place  for morning walks along the beachfront and on the footpaths outside the hotel. The hotel is an easy walk to Bali Collection (which is not quite fully open to pre-covid times.) Cons: This is a very kid friendly resort which is awesome
author: Andyonholiday

comment: As a returning customer, I’ve always been happy with the service and quality to be found at the Melia, Bali however this latest visit shows a real drop in service around the pool and beach bar area. In a lot of cases, customers including ourselves are waiting 45 minutes for a drinks service and when we do get it, staff are confused and serving incorrect/incomplete orders. There’s a very clear lack of experience and an inefficient service. I’ve raised this with the hotel management who seem unconcerned and thanked me for being this to their attention, but have done nothing to rectify it.   To top it all off, whilst sitting to lunch service this afternoon, the hotel have arranged for poison to be sprayed around the patio area which is incredibly strong smelling and clearly harmful
author: Martyn R

comment: Stayed at this resort for 5 days. It was an amazing experience. My family and I had an initial 4 days at Kuta and were looking forward to a relaxing time at this resort. We had taken up the Level package.  On arrival, we were warmly greeted and ushered to the Level lounge for our check in process. Ari was the Level personnel who assisted us. We truly enjoyed her services thru our entire stay. Never without a smile.   We were upgraded to The Level Lagoon Access Junior Suite (we had initially booked a family room). The Junior Suite was less ideal for my family given that my kids had to sleep on a sofa bed vs the proper beds in the family room. But having direct access to the pool from the room was a tad too appealing for them.  Thru the entire stay, it was apparent that the
author: Alvinl01

comment: A week stay in a level all inclusive lagoon access room was a great way to experience a relaxing holiday . The room was spacious, and having immediate pool access was brilliant. Across from the pool was a lawned area with day beds and a bar, which made it feel like a private resort. Food at the various restaurants was good, but the standout meal was at the Japanese restaurant.   There are many areas of the resort which are set up for rest and relaxation, including day beds on the beach which was a nice way to spend the afternoon accompanied with a cocktail.  The resort grounds are extensive, pristine and beautiful. Despite the Meliá being a large resort, all the staff make themselves available to you , and offer assistance in order to ensure you have a wonderful stay. Recommended
author: galavanterAust

comment: I chose Melia Bali because I've stayed in other Melia hotels around the world in the past and always had a pleasant stay and a memorable holiday. Melia Bali is based in Nusa Dua which really quiet and relaxing area, very clean and safe. The whole Bali island is safe but as soon as you come out of Nusa Dua you'll see how crazy busy is the island, especially the traffic, it's like organised mess that somehow seems to work. Comparing to all that Nusa Dua is like a small piece of paradise. The hotel has lovely gardens and massive swimming pool. It also has private beach that is well maintained and clean, its white sandy beach with clear turquoise water. You can walk along the beach for miles to other 5*star hotels that are also on the seafront. The hotel offers bicycles and vast
author: Maria

comment: My husband and i was very very happy to have chosen this resort as our stay in Bali for 8 nights.  We had the lagoon access junior suite and was really happy with that.  Had a choice of our own pool or main pool.  Housekeeping was amazing as it was always done by 1 pm and it was done so so well, very clean and neat.  Beach restaurents and bars and el patio lunch was really good and wasn't expensive.  All staffs were very very friendly and would go their way to do anything for you.  Loved the grounds in melia Bali and is very very well catered for families with children.  We would recommend melia bali to anyone who will be visiting bali.
author: Sophie H

comment: We stayed at Melia Bali for 2 nights and I may say it was wonderful especially for the kiddos. The reception is very informative about all the facilities that they have and all the staffs are very nice and helpful. I even get a free ice cream at the carnival and the taste is super yummy :) The room is quite old but I may say it’s well maintained, however regular check for the shower may be needed. The most impressive from Melia is the kids club. The place is very neat and clean, the activities are very fun for the kids and the staffs are very nice. Thanks to Ibu Sasih and Miss Aci, both of you made the kids are very enjoy to spend their time at the kids club. We're back at our house and the kids are still talking about their experiences with the kids club, like finding a baby
author: Ajeng W

comment: We had a fantastic 5 night stay at Melia. Everything was great! Weather, rooms, food, location, pool were all perfect.   First time O/S with our sensitive/allergy 4 year old, we were a little nervous.   Chef Bayu was exceptional at the breakfast buffet every morning to make our son egg-free pancakes, and nasi goreng. As soon as he saw us he whipped them up and delivered to our table. Amazing service and nerves settled!   The kids club at Melia was our sons highlight! The ladies are so welcoming and friendly. It was like he instantly had a whole team of Aunties. They had great communication with us. We utilised the baby sitting service so we could enjoy some nights out. Maria went above and beyond, swapping her shift so she could babysit for us on our final night. Thank you
author: Talei W

comment: Great activities around hotel, and mostly its free. Quite enjoyable for family traveller.   We stay in family suite, the hallway to our room looks old and scary, the room is well maintained but its clearly shown its age, the furniture, bathroom, etc is old. The tv also quite old too, not smart tv.   Breakfast is good to average, not excellent.   Service hospitality is mixed, they have rules that 14 year old kid is count as adult and have to pay extra charges for room fees, ehem we have stayed in various 5 star hotel in bali and never encounter any problems whatsoever, and we never get warned or told it to our face like that. A bit shocked and dissapointed.
author: Glenn P

comment: We have been coming back to Melia Bali many years in row and we absolutely love the resort. Before descovering Melia, we have tried almost every resort in Nusa Dua, which really is the best area to stay in Bali, especially when visiting with kids, because of the safety and clean beaches. But since we found it, we didn’t want to stay anywhere else. The first time when we booked Melia Bali was only for a week and we end up staying 2 months (Yes, this is how much we loved it!). The main reason was the fantastic Kids Club, which offers 12 hours care for your kids with a new activity every hour. My 8 yo daughter completely loves it and couldn’t wait to go there every day, so we were all able to have a Real vacation, kid’s happily playing while grown ups get to relax by the pool and
author: Annie

comment: We stayed for 11 nights and could not be happier with our choice. Hotel is huge, plenty of space by the pool and beach. The grounds are well kept and truly amazing both during the day and in the evenings when lit with the candles.  Restaurants offer variety of different food, and all inclusive pays off, since includes bikes, and other water sports, along with the food, drinks, snacks.  Our only complaint would be the room, we stayed in family suite and the beds where very squeaky, otherwise room was spacious and very nicely decorated.  Overall would happily come back and recommend.
author: Dejan K

comment: Stayed in October.but don’t think it is 5 star. Front desk staff not very helpful. Breakfast ok, but not great. Room service menu and pool menu very limited. Had renovations on room going on near us and they were working with power tools until 10pm at night.  The rooms were nice but not cleaned that well. The shower is pathetic. If you are over 6 feet tool, then you  can’t even stand up properly as your head hits the ceiling. Very little pressure with the shower aswell.  Paying $11 AUD for a small Bintang at the bar near Lobby is a joke. Had to wait until well  after 3 for check in, and then when asked for a 2 hour late check out, we’re told that we would have to pay for it.
author: Steve F

comment: Just returned from Melia Bali. Everything was superb. The beachfront location is perfect for a relaxing holiday.  All staff members greet you with a smile and a hello every time they see you.  The buffet breakfast has a huge variety and offers something for every nationality and taste.  The three restaurants we ate at were excellent. The Sorrento and Lotus restaurants offered exceptional food quality with excellent service. The Sateria Beach restaurant served incredible quality food in a more relaxed outdoor beach front setting. The steak at the Sateria is as good as you would get in a high end steakhouse! The beach bar is a perfect place for evening drinks however the staff are ran off their feet and could possibly use a couple of extra team members to reduce wait times.  The
author: SydneyFreddy

comment: An absolutely fantastic hotel in a great beach front location with the most welcoming and friendly staff.  Nothing was ever any trouble for the staff and they always wanted to go the extra mile to make sure everything was ok.  The facilities are superb with a great selection of bars and restaurants.  The YHI Spa is immense and one of the most relaxing places.    The gym is well equipped and has everything you need to keep you fit whilst enjoying your holiday.   The hotel is only a few hundred metres from Bali National Golf Course, and to compliment the Golf Course, the hotel has its very own Golf Simulator.  It’s an ultra modern QED simulator with a great selection of courses to choose from.  A special mention has to go to Ian who hosts the Golf Simulator.  He’s an absolute
author: Mark

comment: Oh my God, what a fantastic location for a relaxing holiday, we saw a number of negative reviews that concerned us. However, we are unsure how it could be any better at Melia Bali. This post I want to mention the people at Melia, we  now understand why reviewers mention the Melia people's names in postings. Everyone here is incredible, a bright smile is always showing and a willingness to ensure our holiday is the best it can be.  Really want to mention both Aryawan at Sateria Restaurant  for his absolutely professional and friendly approach and thinking outside the box in making garlic bread appear, and also to the absolutely lovely and delightful Suarni, also at Sateria  who must have the biggest and loveliest smile at Melia. In our top three is Yudi from the Level, who has
author: Stephen C

comment: Had a Wonderful stay over 6 nights at this beautiful resort.  We understood after a welcoming we never will forget, that this stay where to be remarkable. A huge thanks to El (Elok) that took care of us from check in and during our entire stay, always with a smile - thank you El.  Hotel facilities is great, but the staff is beyond amazing. Always with a smile, always there to make sure our stay was as pleasant possible. The Level pool concierge team with: Arta, Juli, Oka and Darma made sure we had everything needed at all times. World class service from the friendliest team ever!  The spa was amazing, with a wide selections of treatments.  Big thanks to the entire Meliá Bali team.  You all made this to a wonderful and pleasant stay.  We will be back  Protip: if you have the
author: Tom

comment: Melia Bali is our go to place of stay everytime we visit Bali! We have stayed there a number of times and always choose The Lagoon Access room (with The Level benefits) to have the convenience of having the pool right by our door step. All the staffs at The Level lounge are very helpful, friendly and pay great attention to detail.  Melia Bali also have daily activities for in house guest to join for those who don't want to head out of the hotel. Plus points that the staffs leading the activities are also very dedicated and fun!  We last visited Melia Bali in Feb 2020 before the borders closed and really cant wait to be back in paradise!
author: Pricilia C

comment: I stayed at the Melia Bali for over a week when I attended a conference in Nusa Dua. The resort is beautiful, and the landscaping is spectacular! Lots of superb Balinese statues, fountains, etc.  I was fortunate to get a special rate due to the conference, so I stayed in a swim-up room with a private pool that only a few rooms could access.   The staff was so gracious and friendly. The food was good. There was even a live Balinese dance performance at one of the restaurants during dinner. The spa was lovely, with extremely affordable treatments.  The beach was very picturesque. The only disappointment was the seawater - it was murky with tiny biting insects!
author: AD

comment: We stayed in the Level Pool Access room all inclusive. We have been coming to this resort for years but on the last 2 occasions we have been disappointed with the food, not a lot of choice and only 2 restaurants open. The all inclusive drinks were limited to local alcohol which is not the best. No Bintang & I could only have cocktails that were on the menu, I asked for a Bailey’s & a cosmopolitan on both occasions I was told it’s not included in al inclusive. I do love the staff the pool access room and the grounds but breakfast & all inclusive I was not impressed with. Friends went in June and said the all inclusive food wasn’t very good & they would rather try somewhere else. Sorry Melia my family & I are back in October for 2 weeks so we decided to try the Sofitel only
author: balloch10

comment: I had to organize a workshop in short notice in Bali, and I found the staff at Melia Bali to be very accommodating and responsive in arranging everything. The workshop went really well, the workshop venue and staff were excellent, the participants enjoyed their rooms and the facilities, and the food were amazing. There are a lot of activities that you can do, including yoga sessions. You can even arrange a private yoga session for IDR 150000, which was worth every penny. Special shout out to Ian for the fantastic yoga sessions. Also special thank you to Ms Azaria Tan and Ms Kadek Ayuni and the rest of the event sales team for their excellent work!
author: Leo

comment: We stayed for 9 nights in October/November and were really impressed with the quality of the resort and the service level provided.  All staff were so welcoming and helpful. We spent the most time with the staff at the Level pool and beach area who attended to our every need and made us feel so welcome. Big thanks to Resti, Pringga, Juli, Oka and Angga who looked after us so well and really made our trip. Can't wait to see them again when we head back next year!   Would definitely recommend purchasing the Level option and all-inclusive. The resort has some gluten free options and we were told they are working towards providing more. We found the best approach (as a coeliac) was to talk directly with the chefs. At El Patio restaurant the chefs were more than happy to point out
author: Richard F

comment: Meliã Bali is a great hotel for families because it includes a kids club and a massive pool that is shared by everyone. There are bikes you can hire for and hour and ride them outside of the hotel. There is a tennis court, archery and a farm located at the back of the main hotel. The staff are very helpful and funny as they have a lifeguard for the pool and people to go in the pool and play stuff like basket ball. The food is excellent with a breakfast buffet every morning and then drinks on them side of the pool. There are manny restaurants that you can try each with a different menu. I recommend that if you come to Bali you go to Meliã Bali.
author: Peter

comment: Staff not welcoming, and rooms are old, the queue for breakfast is super long, and they don't want to do anything about it. The only bright side is the waiters in the beach area trying to do their best. Even you can get a better price for the rooms from some agent than getting the price from the hotel themselves, so at least you can have someone who will listen to you if you have any complaints
author: Haig B

comment: First of all, the hotel itself is very clearly aiming at families with children who go for the all-inclusive/level experience. Travelling with my brother, both adults over 30, we were a bit apprehensive about this, as our experience with such hotels are that they are great when you have kids, but underwhelming when you do not want to sit still and a have a minimum of new impressions. We did not go for the level nor all inclusive, as we wanted to mainly use the hotel as a base and travel around other places during the day.  The hotel itself is very nice, although bearing some signs that the ongoing renovations are necessary. Our room was clean, with frequent visits from house cleaning, and with the little time we spent inside very much suited our needs. The laundry service was
author: Rocketp4nts

comment: It's an amazing experience staying here.  We stayed for 4 days and were very satisfied.  We got a free upgrade to lagoon access so we can jump to the pool from our room everytime we want.   The staff are very friendly, especially Ms. Yuli who is very helpful with her extraordinary hospitality, she made sure we got all our needs during our stay.  The covid-19 protocol is executed very well.  They used blue ray to sterilize the room before we checked in,  and then they sealed the room until we came. The rooms are cleaned and disinfectant every day. Cutlery, amenities and everything else is provided according to our request so that it remains sterile. This made us feel very safe staying here during the pandemic. Becoz that's the most important thing for us before deciding where to
author: rizka syahputri

comment: It’s my final day after 12 nights at the Melia Bali Nusa Dua.  I’ve been completely overwhelmed by the kindness, generosity and genuine caring shown by everyone who works at this hotel. For the few nights I stayed in a swim up room, it was spacious, comfortable, if a little far away from everything. Swimming in the evening from the deck was great.  For the last week I stayed in a pool villa and I have no words to describe how fantastic the experience was - I don’t want to leave! The breakfast is the highlight for me, both the buffet and the Level access only. Out of this world amazing and Chef Bayu is outstanding. I used the spa facilities several times and always asked for Catur. The massage is to die for and the view as you sip tea after your treatment is so peaceful.  My
author: Lisa C

comment: Traditional Balinese feel on entry into foyer, lovely staff, beautiful gardens and old school Bali feel hotel. Being ND drinks etc around pool more $$ than what they feel they deserve to be. We travelled with teens and I think this hotel is definitely geared for little kids (actually great for little kids) but if you want a more relaxed feel around the pool you won’t find it here. Aqua aerobics was fun, the beachfront was beautiful to relax on and the dinner at the beach restaurant definitely felt like you were on a tropical Balinese holiday. I think for our family or for couples there are much better choices in ND but if you have little ones I think you would be happy here.
author: Summerjean

comment: We stayed for 3 nights at Melia, and as someone who has travelled to plenty of countries and places I'd say it's one of the best resorts we've stayed at so far. The environment of the hotel is beautiful, with lots of greenery in the garden. The room was a bit old but very clean and comfortable. All the staff were super nice and friendly to make sure we have the best experience. The beach was alright, the water was quite shallow compared to other beaches we've been to as well, especially during low tide, so very suitable for young children. The food at the restaurants were all amazing, some said that the prices were too high but we found them quite reasonable for a luxury resort. There were also a lot of activities offered such as yoga and bicycle rental, so you'd never get bored
author: Echo C

comment: It was great to back to Bali after being locked up during COVID, and great that tourist activity was back for the local economy and staff. Melia location was great, loved being able to walk along the beach track and to local beach stores.  The pool and grounds were fantastic, and the kids loved the large pool - we sat in a different location every day and our favourite was the little island area in the middle. The rooms were clean and comfortable, and food options were generally OK, but I would have preferred an all-inclusive package next time to avoid the surcharges.  A highlight of the hotel and our stay were the activities by the pool, especially the water aerobics and water sports. Agus was a champion and was there everyday full of spirit and fun in the pool and on the
author: britt00023

comment: Our stay at the Melia was fantastic. The kids club was a highlight, with their friendly and kind staff. Even in times of Covid, all the members of the staff, from room service to aquatic sports crew, deck managers, etc went above and beyond to accommodate all of our needs. Breakfast was really good and served quickly, however some of the other dishes off the menu at later meals were sub par and overpriced.
author: erodrigues2021

comment: The Melia Bali is an amazing hotel with beautiful grounds. We stayed in a junior suite with a swim out lagoon. Attention to detail from staff was outstanding. Food and and atmosphere was also wonderful. Many daytime activities are offered by the hotel. Location was perfect close proximity for beach walks, bike rides, water sports, restaurants and day spas. Local business will pick you up from the hotel and drop you back at no additional cost.
author: weloveholidays2018

comment: We stayed at the Melia hotel for 7d6n, we were able to upgrade the room (we are get lagoon access), the service was very friendly, the rooms were clean, the food was delicious for breakfast and dinner. The hotel & beach facilities are very good & clean, health protocols are strictly enforced. Especially for the kids club, my children are very happy here, there are many activities for children, the companions are also very friendly and can mingle with the children.   "Special thanks to miss Devi, Dayu, Sasih, Tya, Acik (from Kids Club)."  Best Regards Arwin & Felicia + Aldrich & Alden
author: Arwin S

comment: This is not the first time we stay in this hotel. We've repeated because it is the best hotel.   The attention is wonderful, all the personal is very educated and kind.   We have gone with kids and all the time the staff be attentive to what we may need.   The hotel is really very well for children, they have a lot of activities for them: kids club with lovely wooden toys, small cars, bicycles, kallak, small pool...   The food is also very good. You have a lot of options in the breakfast and for lunch and dinner you can choose international food. Also you have the option of different flavours of ice cream that children will love.   The room is very spacious for kids, no mosquito in the room and no mosquito outside.   Definitely, if you are planning to go to Bali with kids, this
author: Myriam

comment: We were lucky enough to take the all-inclusive option at this hotel and boy did it deliver.  Great value for money.  The staff were fabulous, never once did I see anyone without a smile on their face; very helpful indeed.  There were numerous activities for all ages, with specific activities for small children, teenagers and adults alike; each and every day.  You can be as active or inactive as you want. The location is right on the beach, a beautiful breeze surrounded by magical and very well-keptF gardens that are a credit to gardening staff.  Highly recommend this location.  we'll be back.
author: Julie F

comment: Large complex with pools, manicured gardens and beach access. A selection of restaurants and bars which cater for most tastes. We stayed in a junior suite and chose ‘the Level’ package (see more later).  The staff are wonderful, they’re helpful, cheerful, and can’t do enough for you. Add to that the attention to detail for example reading glasses on the bar (in case you forget yours) waiters bringing cool towels, afternoon tea by the pool, a waiter offering to clean your glasses etc.  The Level package gives you access to a reserved beach area with beds and the same waiter service and a separate swimming pool which does not have children in it. I’ve nothing against children but sometimes one appreciates grown up space and a bit of peace. You also get afternoon tea round the pool
author: Simon C

comment: Our stay at the Melia Bali was incredible. The staff were the highlight of our visit as they take great care of you the whole time you're there. We stayed in a family suite that spans over two floors that gave us great views of the gardens and swimming pool. We'd like to mention in particular the staff at the kids club who took great care of our two children during our stay. Our 4 year old daughter was in tears when we were leaving as she misses them already. Thank you Dani, Maria, Desi, Resi, Graney, Tya, Sasih, Ali and anyone I've missed out that is at the kids club (apologies if I've misspelled your names!!) You guys were exemplary!  See you next year David Sutton
author: David S

comment: We stayed at the Melia for 2 nights. Would have stayed for 5 but decided to go home early.   Pros. Very friendly staff, they are so helpful and professional, beautiful hotel grounds. Clean and comfy beds. Beautiful views. Our headboard was filthy and the staff arrived within minutes to clean and change the bedsheets.  Cons. The pool has no shade so you can't swim in the day. The bath and bathroom is very tiny. My husband was to tall to shower and to tall for the bath. Water doesn't get hot and the plug didn't work so the water runs out quickly, enamel comes off in the tub. They have these beautiful cabanas on the beach that don't allow children. Also you have to pay extra if you want the privilege of using it. Pretty ridiculous considering that there was no one around. I hate to
author: Cornel

comment: We had a family room, which was a big success. A minor point would be the shower, which is in the bathtub. A good vibe overall in the hotel and modestly crowded for breakfast an around the pool. Kids club by all means is good and special thanks to Dani that took care of our two kids many times. Moreover, the biggest smile of the whole hotel came every morning from Syauqi. Great service from him and nice interesting discussions in the morning.
author: MaartenAltena

comment: Stayed for 3 nights at the room with direct access to pool. Room was super nice, pools were spectacular, staff were super nice. Good place to spend holiday with young children as they provide lots of kids activity, such as: sand painting, feeding the fishes, roasting marshmallow, movie night, playground was huge and they disinfect the toys regularly. The room was also disinfected prior to our stay. Very good and strict health protocol as well as during breakfast. Breakfast buffet was vary and delicious. The beach was awesome and we could do sport activities like canoeing and biking surround Nusa Dua. Such a pleasant stay. We will definitely be back.
author: DyahSaptaria

comment: We spent a week in beautiful Melia with our 6yo and 4yo. We were looking for a week where we could completely switch off and not worry about anything. Melia delivered far beyond what we anticipated.   To start, the grounds are absolutely stunning, a tropical paradise. The kids loved the local ducks wandering around, the main pool is excellent for all ages, poolside service for food and drinks. Highly recommend all inclusive, it’s worth every bit. The Japanese restaurant, Sakura is excellent. We dined there three times during our stay. El Patio was also good, however Sateria and Sorrento weren’t great. Overcooked and bland seafood on two occasions.   Other than this, the food was great, lots of variety for sweet and savory and the kids loved the ice cream available at any time.
author: Dee C

comment: Me and my husband were in Bali from 25 April to 1 June. Our first stop , for 2 days, was in Ubud at Alaya Resort 4* a very pleasant hotel, good services, but a strange breakfast (a plate of some fruits, three choices of main breakfast, pastry, tee, coffee, no decaf). But life music in the evening. We visited Monkey forest, Royal Palace, the Market is under construction, and the Elephant Temple. A lot of restaurants and coffee shops.  Next and main stop was at Melia Bali. On the road to the hotel we visited the rice plantation, coffee plantation (with the famous Luwac coffee), temples, and the active volcano mountain (just seat at a restaurant having lunch and admiring it). At Melia Bali everything was beautiful except the humid (87%) climate and the tide that made you after
author: mrs_nana

comment: We stay for five nights. Staff was very kind, always willing to care about us. The food was amazing in every single restaurant.  Breakfast in Sorrento was unique, we enjoyed dinner in Santeria with beautiful views and outdoor atmosphere plus alive music every night.  The dinner at Lotus was very special and included a cultural dance entertainment.  There are variety of activities through the day.  You must try yoga class to start the day, with Spa treatments which centred out body and soul, beyond expectations. The daily maintenance at your room was very efficient. The gardens and Hotel areas were very well maintained with good attention to the detail. We really enjoy our stay and for sure we recommend  Melia Bali at Nusa Dua.
author: Jose R

comment: Everything about the Melia Bali at Nusa Dua was amazing.  It was the best holiday we have ever had.  From the moment we arrived, we were treated like Royalty, nothing was too much trouble for the wonderful staff who looked after us for the entire time we stayed at Melia.  The whole environment of the Melia at Nusa Dua was awesome, our room was perfect, with access to the Lagoon pool and cocktail bar from our room.  The 5 restaurants were great, and we especially enjoyed the facilities afforded to us a Level guests:  private access to beach and pool, cocktails in the Level Lounge, and so much more.  I cannot stress how wonderful the staff at Melia were, we wanted for nothing and they made us feel so welcome.  A special shout out must be given to our personal Concierge Yudi, and
author: Alison

comment: I was very lucky choosing this Hotel, this area and "The Level" family suite (in fact I didn' know) for a week for me and my family. The staff was more than polite, the "Level" experience was fabulus, offering us the perfect alla cart menu breakfast at Sorrento restaurant + evening coctails before dinner (I am expecting the recipy of the Gin Bnt - if I remember well the name) ecc. I won't forget the food at the hotel's restaurants- we dine outside the hotel just once and it wasn't satisfying as in Melia. Complimenti to the Chefs. The big tropical gardens,  the pools, the squirrels coming up to the 4th floor during the day set a magic scenery. If the journey to Bali wasn't so long from Greece, I would go there  every year and at the same hotel. Very relaxing place.  Thank you
author: Mary T

comment: I have stayed at this place many times over the years and I keep coming back to it as I believe it represents the best value for money in Bali. We have stayed at a number of all inclusive resorts in Nusa Dua but this is hands down the best All-Inclusive Resort in Bali. When shopping for All Inclusive - Check the Fine Print. This resort gives you 6 different restaurant options and they are all next Level. I have had the best Japanese and Indonesian Cuisine here EVER. You can order a meal or a drink by the pool or just get an ice cream or s steak on the beach. The service is always good and the staff will meet just about any request you may have. If you are celebrating an occasion, they make you feel super special. It is a beautiful morning pushbike ride and its walking distance
author: Marie C

comment: February 2020 was the last time we stayed at the Melia Bali. We would have had a another holiday there by now but thanks to COVID that is not possible. We have stayed  at the Melia a number of times and we are always impressed by the staffs dedication to ensuring guests are extremely well catered for. The hotel and the rooms have a strong Balinese influence, the gardens are always lush and immaculately maintained as well as the pool and beach areas. We enjoyed the attention from the Level staff who, while looking after us so well,  were always fun to be around.
author: Johns

comment: We can say that Nusa Dua is not the typical Bali location, there are only resort  nearby. This can be a little frustrating when you want to go and eat elsewhere (If you aren't there with all inclusive). The staff is very helpful and kind and the pool area and the surroundings are very nicely maintained. The breakfast was varied and tasty. the prices for lunch or dinner are  expensive compared to other restaurants. The room was clean, we really enjoyed the 2 bathroom areas. It's a good place if just want to relax. The spa area is very nice.
author: Bela_Pr

comment: When choosing our accommodation we were suggested the Melia. On reading reviews we noticed The Level being mentioned alot and found a number of extras that you got with this offer. So we went for it and we were extremely happy we did.  Unbelievably happy.  On arrival we were taken to an air conditioned room and given a glass of bubbly while they looked after booking us in.  Then we were offered nibbles to have which coincided with the 2 hour happy hour that you get every night as part of this deal. Our holiday was blowing us away and we had only just arrived!!  Our room was two level and it was beautiful. Very spacious.  We had fruit and water delivered everyday. Our 4 poster bed was very comfy as were our pillows.   With The Level we had a seperate pool and seperate beach front
author: Michelle Brown

comment: I've only put this review forward as I didn't want my friends suffering the same dissapointment as we did. They were thinking of booking for next year. Only stopped for 4 nights on our way back from Australia. Bad points: All 4 rooms we were shown had a damp musty smell. Very slow service, best go to the Bar and get your own.  Food ok if you were a meat eater. When asked for a vegetarian option, we were shown just vegetables. There were no complete balanced vegetarian meals to include protein.  The free hire bikes were badly maintained, tyres almost flat and brakes not adjusted correctly. Cheap, uncomfortable loungers by the pool and beach. Beach full of plastic litter. Guest relations manager very unsympathetic,  only offered a foot massage and a day at the 'exclusive' pool
author: steve m

comment: We started our holiday in Hard rock which had given us a fabulous experience and we were excited for the Melia.We arrived here around 2.40 pm to absolute chaos at the check in area..We were asked to take a seat and were offered a welcome drink and the lady said she would be back.We sat and waited patiently and 10 minutes later I could see other families coming straight in and checking in while we waited and waited..I asked the lady what was happening and she said she would come back.After a few minutes I got frustrated and went up to reception to see what was happening and if we could check in.I got speaking to someone from guest relations and they told us our room was ready.. When we got to our family suite I was very disappointed as it did not match the photos at all.The room
author: Emer L

comment: Fantastic place to bring your kids. The all inclusive deal is so good, having the choice of restaurants was great and the fact the kids could get drinks and ice-cream all day made them very happy! The entertainment every day was great for young children and older children.  The only negative was the rooms could do with a refurb and we had to ask for them to be re-cleaned.  The sheets seemed damp but I think it’s just the rooms that were damp! The resort made up for these small things and we would go again and also recommend Melia to other families.
author: Mangos

comment: We satyed at the Melia Bali over new year. The hotel is advertised as 5 star but is more like 3 star. We upgraded to a lagoon access junior suite at considerable cost. The room was clean but in desperate need of a refit as it was quite dated. On 2 occasions we had to complain about building work being carried out close to our room. Luckily we recorded the noise as the guest relations tried to deny it. Apparently we were not the only guests to complain but the management tried to fob us off.  Quality of food and drinks was very good but was let down by poor choice and poor service in the restaurants and on the beach front deck area. On one occasion it took almost 2 hours from entering the restaurant to leaving. We were all inclusive and what we did notice was that guests who were
author: Ian J

comment: Since we can't go outside Indonesia during pandemic, we decide to refresh ourselves to Bali and spent 3 night here at Melia Hotel Nusa Dua. Our room have direct access to the lagoon pool which is perfect for the kids as they can swim anytime from the room. During our stay there, hotel guest capacity still very low so they only open 1 restaurant near the beach. Since not many people stay at the hotel, we utilize our time to explore and enjoying the beach as like our private beach.overall we enjoy ourtime here and definitely will come again next time.
author: hieks7683

comment: This is the second time at Melia Bali. We love it here it’s an amazing experience and we will return for sure.   Our little one loved all the kids club experiences. Shout out to Maria, Sadie, Tya, Graeny, Dewi, Acy, Elsa. Thankyou also to Resi for being our amazing private nanny when we needed her.  All of the activities at Meliá are amazing. The options for families, couples or solo travellers are endless. Special shout-out to Agus for his amazing hospitality and service. His expertise in aerobics, yoga, gym, golf and tours is wonderful.   We have done the all inclusive option twice now and it is a must! Food and drinks within resorts can be expensive and the all inclusive option takes the hassle of worrying about any money related things.   We can’t wait to return!
author: Elouise A

comment: To be honest, this hotel is quite old, was build in 1985 but the maintenance in this hotel area was awesome.   Some good points from my side: 1. Cleanliness in hotel room and on the hotel area, such as Swimming pool and beach was good 2. The service from the hotel staff was awesome. Everyday they will keep asking for feedback and improvement, and after you said, they follow up your comment. Melia do really good in term of train the employee to give best service to the guest.  3. As all people said, i have to put two thumbs up for their "Kids Club". The activity was amazing and the staff there was really engage with your kids and it they really sincere and taking care your kids really well. The place has several restaurants with different style of food; pricey but most of the times worth the value. We've had a couple disappointments during our stay though, on the first night we headed to the restaurant by the seafront and, when we asked for plates we had no response, my husband had to get up and fetch it himself. On another ocasion we asked for a meal in one of the restaurants and had a rushed up sloppy meal. Other than that, it was nice. Plus having a meal and have the kids interact with the squirrels that watch from the trees around the tables. Location was great. The beach where it's located is
author: renataabraham

comment: Short of an actual golf course, the Melia Bali has everything you could want. While any regular room would serve you well, we would recommend going for the awkwardly named "LEVEL" upgrade, which comes with the swim-in lagoon rooms and can also be purchased separately. It gives access to the private Level pool and Level beach area, with pimped-up sunbeds and unlimited suntan cream of SPF 25 and 50. The main pool has lots of noisy kids, even in the off season, as well as group activities to keep you exercised and happy. While the main restaurant serves a buffet breakfast to cater for every possible taste, Level guests can also breakfat on the beack or in the quiet and pleasant Sorrento restaurant. All in all, the on-site upgrades cost as much as the room itself, and were worth it.
author: permorten

comment: Location, overall design with special attention to Balinese style and staff was perfect in Melia Bali. Eventhough we saw some bad reviews about sea before we booked the hotel, sea and beach is perfect and perfectly swimmable. Beach is very clean with all sand. Breakfast and hotel activities like yoga and Balinese dancing courses were also nice.
author: Mus

comment: We stayed at The Melia Bali for seven nights and could not recommended it more. A perfect beachside holiday resort with something for everyone.   We were looking for a mix of chilled poolside days and more active ones. Melia provided both, the service around the poolside was fantastic, especially Febri who looked after us most days, and when we were feeling more energetic, Putu and Ian were on hand to provide yoga, water airobics and pool games. Their tour to Uluwatu was also a highlight.   Staff at all the restaurants on site were attentive without being overbearing, nothing seemed to be too much trouble.  Highly recommended staying at this hotel for your next trip to Bali.
author: Rob L

comment: We recently stayed at the Melia hotel for 6 nights (we extended our stay!).  Fantastic hotel, breakfast is a dream. We paid for The Level access and you could have lobster every morning if you wished. Also the homemade Nutella is unbelievable.   My children both wanted to be in the kids club all day everyday, a special mention to Sonaa and Graney they were fantastic with the kids. My little one is only 3 so a parent did have to stay - they can stay alone from 4.   Staff were amazing throughout. When we arrived the hotel was operating at only 20% capacity. It got busier as the week went on and the service did get slower (dinner in the evening). I would be interested to see what service would be like at full capacity…….   The beach is great, however, the beach sellers are quite
author: Claire H

comment: I always had a wonderful time at Melia Bali. I've stayed at this hotel whenever i visit Bali. The hotel is located right infront of the beach. The staff of the level service are great & attentive. Get the level lagoon access room. Melia Bali also provide  free daily activities throughout the day which guest can participate. Also, if you get the all-inclusive package, almost everything such as meals/drinks/dessert are already included in the room price. Definitely recommended for guest who are looking to relax & not worry about anything.
author: Deminthu

comment: Visited Melia in late October 2020, and pretty much enjoyed our stay. Children (9 and 13 yo) had a lot of fun in kids club of best quality. More importantly, we felt very safe despite the times of pandemic: all COVID-19 protocols have been followed and taken seriously everywhere throughout the hotel, maintaining great cleanliness at all places. All staff were incredibly friendly and attentive. Great overall experience. Would definitely come back.
author: Ravshanbek

comment: The resort is excellent in all respects but I would like to give particular credit to Chef Bayu in the El Patio Restaurant. Whilst the world in general seems to be addressing celiac issues in a much more positive way today, problems often loom large at breakfast time. However, the care and attention that I received from Chef Bayu during my stay made breakfast a stress-free and enjoyable meal. Mind you, visitors will find that the staff working throughout the resort add that sought after pampered feeling to one's stay.
author: Icantbendit

comment: Booked in for 12 nights B&B from 9th Mar 2020. The Hotel is maintained to a very high standard. Obviously prices of food and drinks etc are slightly more expensive than restaurants and bars outside of hotel complex. The rooms are very comfortable, and are cleaned to a very high standard, even to a maid attending in the evening to turn down the bed and leave chocolates, excellent. The staff are  amazing, Reception, Restaurant, Bar, Cleaners, and General Service staff are all so friendly and helpful, they simply cannot do enough to ensure you enjoy your stay in the Hotel and Bali. After 12 Days, our departure flight was cancelled and rearranged for 2 days later, the hotel had no hessitation in making our room available for us to let for the extra 2 nights. The facilities at the
author: A161F

comment: This is the best family hotel and best couples hotel in Bali! They have the widest variety of wonderful free activities including; kayaking, paddleboarding, archery, pool, table tennis, exceptional kids club that focuses on great activities not devices, nightly movies under the stars with popcorn, nightly bonfires on the beach with marshmallows, cycling, lovely pools, soccer, tennis, paddle tennis, water polo, yoga, etc.  The rooms are amazing especially the villas and lagoon rooms, perfectly clean and well maintained.  It is in the best location in Bali with a beautiful  beachfront and so many places to explore nearby on foot or bike or go-kart! author: greg f

comment: We had a wonderful two week stay in this beautiful hotel. Attentive staff, beautiful gardens and pool area, food and drink all very enjoyable and we would recommend the all inclusive package. Special mention to Agus Mahendra who looked after us by the pool and made sure we were kept supplied with snacks and drinks. He made our holiday extra special and was a great representative for the Melia.
author: David S

comment: I stayed at Melia with my mother and partner for 5 nights on their 'The Level' all inclusive package. The service that we received was phenomenal. The staff were all extremely friendly and nothing was too much trouble. We had access to a separate Level pool and beach which gave the whole experience a feeling of exclusivity. On the all inclusive package we got to sample all 5 of the restaurants and most enjoyed Sakura which was Japanese. The food was at high Australian standard and the cocktails tasty and innovative. The rooms at the resort are a little dated but overall we had a fantastic experience. Very much recommended for a relaxing family beach stay in Bali.
author: Travellingman73

comment: This was our first time in Bali but certainly will not be our last.  This hotel was breath taking and had a bit of everything.  It in the luxury hotel district of Nusa Dua with pristine clean roads in the beautiful Balinese architecture all around.  The hotel itself has its own beach front with access to watersports, several restaurants, plenty of pools and activities for families include health and fitness.  We particularly enjoyed the  early morning Yoga near the beachfront with the sounds of the waves with our fantastic instructor Ian.  The people of Bali are generally extremely welcoming and the staff at the hotel were no exception.  As well as Bali also have to make special mention of Riya one of the front desk hosts who always seemed to be there when we needed some help.
author: jasyb5

comment: The hotel is a beautiful place to stay. The rooms are large and comfortable and ours had a lovely view over the gardens which are gorgeous, like looking out over paradise. There is a large pool and also you are right on the beach too. The staff are wonderful and can’t do enough for you, so polite and helpful. A special mention for Witana who is in charge of reception who sorted out a problem we had very efficiently and with a smile. I can’t recommend this place highly enough.
author: Sharon P

comment: We were here in February for 10 nights. One day of rain all day, for the rest occasional showers. We had the Level package, included adult only swimming pool, beach area, swim up room, all inclusive, Level lounge with concierge services, supplied by Yudi and Surya, could not ask for better service, always with a smile. I would not go for anything else, excellent value for money. Room was very spacious and quiet with swim up level pool. Bed was extremely comfortable. There are 5 main restaurants, Lotus serves excellent Asian food and has live Balinese dancers every night but no air conditioning. Sateria is al fresco on the beach with live jazz music and fire dancers on Saturday night, gets very hot as the sun goes down as the humidity rises from 68 to 85%. El Patio does buffet
author: Jan K

comment: We have enjoyed many stays at Melia Bali, and now back since Covid restrictions have lifted. We enjoy the lovely view from the rooms, the beautiful gardens including the ducks!, the tasty food and relaxing atmosphere….but most of all it’s the Staff that make this hotel so enjoyable. Every time we stay we are impressed by their smiles and their positive attitude.  After two years of almost no tourists, meaning no work, the current Staff are all so helpful and friendly. From the gardeners to the room cleaners, the security staff to the reception desk - all do the Melia proud. This time we want to mention David (Komang) at the breakfast service - very helpful and great service, and Eka Arista at the egg counter - remembering to ask what the temperature was this morning in Melbourne!
author: Ron v

comment: Our family had the most relaxing and amazing time at Melia Bali. We where looking for a place to enjoy with an all inclusive package. The food options, variety of restaurants and services included into the plan where great, the service was always great, everyone attended with a smile. My kids enjoyed the pool service during the day, and the beach restaurant during the evening. We will definitely return for another week to relax and recharge. The hotel location is great, we loved the walks along the waterfront. The only downside was when the tide was low, our beach disappeared. Special thanks to Pak Irul Magician Man , who entertain my son . Meet Pak Suastika every morning at breakfast restaurant who always making sure our stay perfectly great. Many choices of food
