comment: The best thing of the hotel is the garden, pool area, all very well maintenance and spotless.   The hotel charges 300% mark-up for everything including activities. The food sucks and it is definitely not a 5 star. It is an old hotel.Breakfast: big selection - but very poor quality.The Dinner-Restaurants are very expensive. Service: at front desk and Restaurant very poor.  Room: looks 30 years old, it smells disgusting, noisy.The A/C that cooled the air but did not dry it. As a result everything felt damp and in the morning the floor was so humid it was slippery.  I will not go back to Melia and never recommend it either.
author: Passenger32079995262

comment: Melia Bali in Nusa Dua is an older traditional Balinese style hotel on a beautiful property with direct access to the beach. Loved the lagoon access room and also the main pool which has many daily activities on offer. We started each day with a workout at the gym, bike ride along the gorgeous coastline and gym H2O in the pool. All the staff go above and beyond to make your stay as comfortable as possible. I really did not want to leave.
author: JennyW

comment: 5 star experience at melia Bali! the food, the staff and activities were amazing never a dull moment. The staff at this resort weren’t only helpful but extremely friendly! A big shoutout to Febri, Diana, Agus and Haryadi for making our relaxing around the pool a 10/10 with the amazing service, conversation and friendliness it really made our holiday! The food at this hotel was not only delicious but the staff at the restaurants added to the experience with the fast service and great conversation that never failed to make us laugh. Cendana, Syaqui and Yudi from the El patio restaurant are amazing people that deserve huge credit for making my daughters birthday amazing with help organising a cake and surprises. The trips that are offered at this hotel are a once in a life time

comment: Rooms are spacy, clean with good furniture, large beds and clean sheets & towels. Hotel facilities are good as well. Library, gym, pools, etc. - everything is very well managed, cleaned and prepared! Gym room is cool enough.  Nice breakfasts. Though the choice isn't that large, but all products have the right taste, clean and not spicy. Menu is enough for any adult and kid.  Lovely territory with many squirrels, fishes and birds.  Safe place - no snakes or other dangerous creatures.  Sandy beach is nice for kids playing and swimming. Tides are high enough (1,5 m. high) to swim.  Overall amazing experience. Worth to stay at. The pool has mould and moss growing on the swim up bar seats as well as mould in the grout of every tile.  There are tiles missing in the pool.  The loungers are cheep plastic old ones.  The staff in the "spa" are extremely inexperienced when it comes to Mani/pedi.  The gym floor looked like it hadn't been cleaned for months.  the dirty towel basket was still full from the day previous!  no sanitizer or wiped to clean down the machines when finished. On a positive note, the staff are very welcoming and the food was excellent.  This is wrongly star rated.
author: oneill1888

comment: We stayed at the Melia hotel for our quarantine stay. The service was of a very high standard, they clearly take a lot of care to make sure all of your needs are met, from assembling an outdoor gym on request to making specific food for our baby. We really appreciated their focus on guest experience and they were really sweet with our baby. They overall stay was very comfortable during a tricky time during changing quarantine rules. We stayed in the garden villa which I would recommend if staying as a family as you have a lot of extra space and a private pool which was great! The beach is really nice and relaxing too and big bonus during quarantine! Thank you to Epi, Kadek, Ian, Agus, Aris, Dharma, Yoga and the whole team for our experience! 🙏🏼
author: Ian H

comment: I've stayed at the Melia Bali twice now and am consistently blown away by the service and how stunning the resort is. It's massive but still feels intimate, lots of little areas to rest and relax, a gorgeous private beach with bean bags, the resort cafe, cabanas, a hammock, etc.   I love the beachside cafe/restaurant as there's really nothing like dining right next to the ocean. The menu options were rather limited for vegetarians, but the staff was always happy to create something special for me that wasn't on the menu and fit my dietary restrictions, with was really appreciated! Once the several other restaurants on the property open up again post-COVID, I'm sure this won't be an issue at all because they have so many different kinds of cuisine to choose from. author: alexandratsaper

comment: Our stay was fantastic. We would love to stay at the Melia again. The rooms, location, grounds and beach were beautiful. Our favourite part was the buffet breakfast where the staff (our waiter was called David) were so enthusiastic and made us feel so welcome and comfortable.  Thanks Melia! (And thanks David ❤️)
author: Anna W

comment: I don't usually write reviews but this place deserves recognition. We spent 8 nights at Melia and that was just right to unwind, enjoy the hotel facilities and soak up the Balinese culture.  The staff here are so naturally friendly and go out of their way to make you feel special and to accommodate your every wish.  While the hotel is not as new as some others, it is very well maintained. We walked to about eight other neighbouring hotels along the Nus Dua beach front area and none of the others had the Balinese feel and look like Melia has. In our opinion, the pool areas, prolific palm trees, indoor and outdoor dining areas, entertainment and Balinese architecture make this the best hotel in Nusa Dua. We highly recommend it.
author: Dino V

comment: I'm not the kind of person who likes to write in Online, but this hotel is a worth to try. I stayed here during the meeting in Bali and I'm pleased with everything this hotel offered. The room is nice, the breakfast is good, the hotel is huge with green ambience. The food at the sea side restaurant is well served, but the most recognisable is the service delivered by the staff, they are very helpful if you need some assistance. Special attention to Ms. Gita, the Manager who's very helpful and willing to do extra in following up my concerns, Ms. Epi and Mr. Adi at Reception who also provide best service in providing information and not to to forget the staff at breakfast who cater my needs since I'm a Vegetarian. Well done Melia, will definitely be back but for holiday not for
author: Adj B

comment: We stayed for 14 nights on the all inclusive with our children aged 5 and 9.  The hotel is extremely well set up for kids. Excellent kids club with lovely staff and lots of different activities to keep children busy.   The girls loved the marshmallow roast on the beach every night and the movies under the stars after. In fact they enjoyed it so much that on several nights they refused to come to dinner with us and instead stayed at kids club and we had their dinners delivered to them as it was open till 9pm.  Resort itself was lovely, only slight disappointment was that only 4 out of the 5 restaurants were open and I’d have loved to have tried the Japanese.  We liked the 2 story family room. Staff were welcoming and helpful, great kids meals available especially for fussy eaters.  My daughter loved kids club, went twice a day! Thank you again to all the staff, we will definitely be returning hopefully next time we will choose the Lagoon access room.

comment: We stayed for 3 days with a free upgrade to a family suite. The resort is strategically located with an access to a beautiful beach. The tropical gardens and pools are amazingly designed. On top of the activities that we can find in any other Kids Club, they offer indoor and outdoor activities such as swimming, marshmallow roasting, and movie night. The Miss who is taking turn to stay with my kid is also communicative and easy to talk with. As a mom, this is a big plus point. I am more confident to trust my kid with them. A big compliment for Ms Dani, Sasih, Tya, Acik, Graney and Resi. Thank you for making our stay memorable.

Despite the great age this hotel is well maintained and doesn’t express negative feelings. I truly liked the food they cook there. I enjoyed both breakfasts and dinners at main restaurant. author: Kez

Got great help also when I realized a week later that I had forgotten a jumper in the room. Kids club is sooooo good and also free. All the staff there were so nice, thank you Dayu, Sasih, Finda, Graney and  Rési for taking such good care of our kids that they preferred staying with you :-)   The beach is beautiful and not so big waves as other hotels nearby (stayed at grand Hyatt later on) Only downside was that the food is quite expensive and not local.   Would definitely recommend this place to anyone!
author: sara

comment: I could not have imagined a better quarantine. Huge  room with a terrace in contact with the swimming pool. The quality of the food was amazing and they could delivered it to your room or even to the beach. All of this could be possible thanks to a very polite staff. I have to give special thanks to the guy in charge, specially, of the activities: Ian.  His morning activities, such as yoga or pilates, were very well imparted and  he was also very active in proposing any other activities (paddle surf, table tennis, stretching...) in order to make your quarantine a very good warm up of your holidays! Highly recommendable for everyone who is planning to come to Bali!
author: Estanis Arena

comment: We are a family of 5 from Australia and purchased the all inclusive package for 7 nights.From the moment we arrived to the sad moment when we left, we were treated to fantastic service, heaps of smiles. wonderful food and drinks  We absolutely loved every minute at the Melia. The team at Melia went out of their way to make our stay really special.  We spent most of the time in the pool which was a short walk from our clean and tidy room. Each day we were greeted with a smile from the Level Pool team (Nova, Darma, Adi K and Resti). comment: It is an oasis of peace and tranquility after busy and chaotic work throughout the day. The place is huge and the gardens make the place balanced with the structure. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly. The breakfast area is large to accommodate the guests without looking crowded. The rooms were nice and well supplied. No complaints. They have a gym which I would use daily. Access to the beach and a very lively Restaurant on the beach. Will definitely come back.
author: krazy_kolyn

The only reason I stay here is I have free worry to leave my daughter in their kids club while I am swimmingat the beach, spa or join Yoga classes or do shopping in different cities, the kids can stay until 8pm. I feel like I have a private day care. It's free and many kids activities. My daughter always wants to go back to this resort for their kids club and archery activities. She remember all the staffs name who looked after her, nice experiences for her. Thank you to Miss Sasih, Miss Rinsih, Miss Dayu 1 and Miss Dayu 2,  Miss Tya who works there. Thank you for the 15mins massage from Miss Diah for my daughter. Also Adrian the Yoga instructor who is very

It made the long flight worth with.  After settling in, we decided to try the activities that Melia Bali offered.  The instructors, Iain and Agus, were awesome.  I can't say enough good about them. author: Bradley N

comment: We are interested to spend night at Melia Hotel because we got recommendation from our friend and also saw positive reviews about the hotel on social media with a lot of interesting activities. Well, it is beyond our expectation. This hotel has very friendly staff and fast response service especially staff who handle all activities starting from watersport until archery. Melia has been successful to form caring staff which is an extraordinary staff. Thanks to  Alep at Water Sport, Irul at gym, Agung at Archery and for sure, to Mrs Dayu who helps us everyday to arrange the activities so we tend to choose spending all the time at hotel. In this pandemic, your hotel can give us unforgettable service. Certainly, we will be back with friends and family. Ps : super love with lagoon
author: Pretty Angel B

comment: Would like to thank all the amazing staff at the melia bali for an amazing honeymoon. It was a short visit unfortunately but defiantly one to remember. We stayed in one of the junior suites with the lagoon pool. The grounds are truly stunning with beautiful gardens and poolside with plenty of activities available each day and even kids movie nights. We went for an all inclusive package and it was the way to go and great value for your money. Highly reccomend this resort for honeymooners or even families too. Staff were so friendly and helpful and a special mention to one bar staff member tude who went above and beyond to see that we were looked after for our stay. Also live band music every night down at the beach restaurant was our favourite spot to dine each night. Food was
author: Nicola

comment: My husband and I adore this resort for the best Bali stay possible, and even though it's an older one, it's still up there with the newer resorts along the Nusa Dua beachfront. We stayed very recently and also in November 2019 both on nine night all-inclusive reservations. I would highly recommend the 24/7 all inclusive package as the food and drinks are wonderful. Set in beautiful and expansive gardens with good-sized, clean rooms, good beds and wonderful staff, this hotel my not be young in age but can still hold its own with the sheer spendour of it all. The lagoon beach is spectacular for both the view of Mt Agung and other volcanoes, and at high tide or mid-tide, it's an absolutely stunning and safe place to swim. Coming from an Australian who loves the beach and swimming
author: JulesArch

comment: Even though the building is quite old but they are all well maintained. Staff are friendly. Kids love the carnival events every weekend and also the marshmallow on the beach every night at 6pm. We also enjoy biking around nusa dua using their provided bicycle.
author: Khayfuk

comment: As a family of 4, the Melia was great for a holiday. We extended our stay as the whole family was able to pause, have active fun and rest. The Covid 19 protocols were high which meant we could relax and enjoy the sport activities and the peaceful location. All the staff were lovely and helpful but also were not over attentive but there to help if needed. We were upgraded into a beautiful villa with a private garden and small pool which was lovely and unexpected. The breakfast was delicious and plentiful. We had a really lovely time and would definitely like to visit again.
author: Jo F

comment: We were in a lagoon-side first floor room, and had a wonderful time! The entire staff was excellent, caring, and professional. Room was terrific - swimming out from your own teras with private loungers was luxurious, the room cleaning staff was incredible (a shout out to Pak Sumartha, who made sure they came at a good time). The front desk was excellent in caring not only for us, but all situations we observed were handled very well. The restaurant staff was great, food good (especially given COVID restrictions), and pizza on the beach was one of our favorites. Got to try paddle boarding, used the bicycles a lot - in short, had an excellent, relaxing, but not boring time.  Highly recommended! Of the hotels we've stayed in Bali, this is our favorite, and we look forward to
author: wjkowalski

comment: We have been staying at Melia Bali for a month and still going😊. During this pandemic, Melia Bali is such a rare find, the hotel is alive with multitudes of activities, still with full on Covid protocol. It is perfect for my 2 active boys, to have tonnes of options of activities, one day is not enough to keep up. Kayaking, archery, paddle board, and the Junior club activities too such as soccer, tennis, pool games, water polo, and more. In addition to its clean room and beautiful gardens, the hotel staff have been nothing but warm and extremely welcoming made it really hard to leave Melia. Pak Irul, Bu Dayu always around with fun, exciting events such as the Pirate treasure hunt, marshmallow by the beach and movie every night (with popcorn) which was superb! I'd love to mention
author: Eve

comment: Melia Bali is a fantastic and relaxing place to stay. We stayed for 10 nights in a swim up junior suite, all inclusive and we’re also lucky enough to have our wedding day here.   Thank so much to Laras & Aza for being our wedding planners. We had the most beautiful ceremony at the Lotus garden on the grass which, was beautifully decorated. Everyone made us feel so special and seemed genuinely happy for us as we celebrated our special day. Thank you also for all the little surprises throughout the day.   You can do as little or as much as you want at Melia Bali as it has it all. From relaxing at the spa, the large swimming pool or the beach. There are six different activities run every day for adults (they also have a great kids club). There are a large range of things to do for
author: Carlyle & Sophie

comment: We visited Nusa Dua for the first time as a family and stayed at Meliá for nine nights. The resort is beautiful and is a great place for families to come and switch off from the hustle and bustle of the busier parts of Bali. We spent nine days by the pool and three of those were part of the all inclusive package which we highly recommend.  The rooms are dated and could do with some love and attention, but the resort itself has everything you need.  A special shout out to Maria, Danni & Tya of the kids club. You are all incredible, so attentive and friendly. Maria also babysat our children a few times and did an incredible job which we are so grateful for. Thank you!  Another special shout out to Agus and Diane from the pool/restaurant area. They did everything they could to make

comment: During the early PPKM days this year (September 2001), we were pretty much stranded in Bali. Couldn't really go back home, but had to find a place to stay for quite long. It was a tough time for all. Bali was at its quietest. Then we found Melia...  The first time we came to Melia, we were enchanted (shout out to Edmund who initiated a complete hotel tour). My son was so thrilled with the Basketball court (a rare find in Bali hotels) and also the Pirate day, so we decided to stay in Melia for 2 weeks.   I just wanted to express my appreciation & gratitude for all the staffs who had made us feel at home. I can't recall all names. But to those at the breakfast area, thank you for always making sure that we're always taken care of every morning. Missing the cute little squirrels
author: Feska Edena

comment: The lodging is spotless. The help here is additionally brilliant and every one of them are benevolent. They have a ton of facilities for the visitors, like an archery, basketball court, tennis court, and badminton court. We are additionally permitted to get a cano on the private sea shore. The crew are generally truly amicable. They permit breakfast in the room for free as well. Indeed, even with the pandemic going on they are as yet ready to serve us like this... It's simply heavenly, and by the manner in which all the crew follows the health protocol. In any event, while doing one of the exercises there, we are given hand sanitizers.
author: Christien Y

comment: My wife and I enjoyed the Level experience at  Melia Bali. As a well travelled couple, the personal attention that the Level staff provided is as good as anywhere that we have experienced in the world.  A special mention should be attributed to Resti and the Level Pool team as the pride that they take in their work is obvious and very much valued as a guest. We enjoyed their hospitality and warmth immensely.  Thank you to everyone at Melia Bali. We highly recommend this resort and the Level experience  if you are travelling as a couple.  Travis Green
author: Travis G

comment: Our family of 5 have recently returned from staying at Melia Bali - and we absolutely loved it. We were on the all inclusive deal and were thrilled with the service, value and fun we experienced there.  Nothing was too much trouble for the staff.  We particularly loved the poolside service, being able to hire bikes and all of the watersports on offer.  We wanted to give a shout out to Ova, Edmund and Alep for their awesome service and an extra shout out to Soma and Ian. Your tour to the Uluwatu temples was so entertaining.  I can't imagine staying anywhere else in Bali.
author: Leah E

comment: very good hotel, nice garden, excellent restaurants and food .... perfect choice for holiday. Very kind people who try to make your stay unforgettable. Very good food with a variety of cuisine and excellent quality. A perfect place to relax. spend more than seven nights at this hotel and you won't regret it. Breakfast and dinner are quite enough for people who do not like to overeat. There is a sufficient variety of alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks. I recommend upgrading to Level, mostly because of the good breakfast and the better pool available to Level hotel guests
author: Milen G

comment: The Melia experience is always such a delight to the senses. Once again, my family and I stayed in a Lagoon room. They are so spacious and always clean, luminous, beautifully decorated / furnished whilst very kid friendly.  The kids club has gone through refurbishing, it is as new and boasts a beautifully designed indoor wooden playground. An absolute treat the the eyes but also very engaging to develop kids' imagination! The very large outdoor space is also ideal to keep the little ones active and busy with a wide range of activities. Our children love grilling marshmallows on the beach at sunset as well as the movie night with popcorn.  No wonder the Melia thrives by "Soul Matters", everything in the Melia has a soul. Such a beautiful feeling every time we can spend a holiday
author: Aurélie P

comment: The Melia Bali is a wonderful hotel. We have been many times for a 'staycation' over the last few years and we are never disappointed. All the staff go out of their way to make us feel welcome. We have stayed in the lagoon access rooms, the garden villa and amazingly got upgraded to villa 1, which is a two bedroom villa with beach access. Every room we have stayed in has been wonderful in it's own way. There is plenty for the children to do from the go karting to the kids club to the bikes to the water sports. The Melia really do try to keep their guests entertained even in these hard times. I feel they go out of their way to make your stay as fun and relaxed as possible. The staff at the Melia are absolutely amazing. They are kind, attentive and always have a smile. The
author: Chloe O

comment: We had five glorious days here, the second week in December, to celebrate my husband's birthday.  We had three rooms, two adjoining and one next to them.  In our party were my husband and myself, my 24 year old son and my daughter, her partner and our beautiful grandson.  This is such a lovely resort and the second time we have stayed here.  We spent most of our five days around the pool or going to the beach.  Our grandson is 18 months old and had a wonderful time.  From where you get your beach towels you can also hire a nanny!  We didn't do this as with five adults there was plenty of babysitters.  Along the promenade there are plenty of restaurants to choose from, most are in the other hotels, or you can take a stroll to Bali Collection and eat there.  It was easier for us
author: travelswithali

comment: I stayed in a lagoon room with my wife and son last week it was more fun than our last stay. It's the only hotel in the area which provides canoe and kayak that the guest can use for free, this is the main attraction at this hotel for us actually. Bikes are also available for the guests to explore surrounding beach area of the hotel, but we never had the chance to try it because we were too excited kayaking.  Despite the challenge in this difficult situation I saw all staff of Melia Bali are fully committed in the healthy and safety of their guests which made us feel safe staying here. There are some adjustments at public area but we know it's for the sake of everybody's health and it's everywhere not just at this hotel, they've worked extra miles so that their guests can have
author: rudit s

comment: The Melia exceeded all of our expectations over and over again! We have stayed at a few different 5-star resorts in Bali, and this was by far our favorite, and we will always return here. From a beautiful child-friendly beach to the marshmallow roasting for kids in the evening, my children had the best time. The kids club was amazing, the bikes for kids to ride all over the resort were so much fun! At breakfast in the morning, Hendra and his team were welcoming and were very attentive to all of our needs, the breakfast options were also delicious. The manager Suarstika spoke with my family many times to make sure we were happy and comfortable and really made us feel special. We will return to the Melia again soon!
author: brittanyinbali

comment: My family and I stayed for 5 nights back in September and we had a wonderful time. My parents came along and they were very impressed with the hotel and the facilities available.  Our two young children (5 and 7) also thoroughly enjoyed their time too.  Every morning they asked when they could go to kids club and join in with the daily activities. We would sign them in in the morning and then go to get them out for lunch but the children insisted on staying at the kids club, so they often ordered and ate lunch their. We would then collect them for dinner which they were also very reluctant to leave. My husband  and I were able to enjoy some relaxation time knowing that the children were happy and being cared for.  The highlight for them was the marshmallow toasting on the beach
author: Lisa

comment: Stayed for a week for our 30th wedding anniversary and had our best holiday yet.We had the all inclusive package with Luxury Escapes which meant no travelling outside for food and drinks. Food was top class at all restaurants, cocktails were great  but the basic spirits menu could be expanded. Gede and Aryawan looked after us on the beach whilst Warniti was excellent in the Coffee Shop. Everyone else we encountered during our stay were very helpful and friendly also. Rooms were clean and tidy , pool area large and well catered for and buffet breakfast was the best we've ever had. Chefs go out of their way to cook something special if you're a Vegan or Vego. We will be coming back especially if the Melia offers another great deal !!
author: Reky

comment: Visited Melia for a workshop by the beach from 3PM to 6PM. The workshop itself provide free flow cake and drink. The staffs were very friendly, always a smile on their face. They give us info about the current event and upcoming event. The one served us were Aris and Pak Eky. Both were very helpful and it’s nice when your waiter/waitress called you by your name, not just some generic “mba” or “ibu”. Before we went home, they gave us some complimentary cake for takeaway! It was the weekend and there was Weekend Carnival and I saw lot of activities for the kid and for the family. There were two entertainers; Alep and Ian. author: Yunisa H

The option of all inclusive at 1.2 million Rupiah a day each (£70) is on the expensive side there are numerous independent restaurants within 10 mins stroll of the complex or 50,000 Rupiah (£3) in a cab. We couldn't get sunbeds by the beach on 2 mornings as people had put their towels on the beds, some beds weren't used until 3pm very unfair. The beauty and splendour of the resort is matched by the gracious and humble staff. From the moment we walked into the lobby we knew we had arrived in paradise. This place is spectacular and yet peaceful. It caters for all age ranges and is very safe for children. The tour advisor Tini was wonderful and gave us a beautiful tour visiting a traditional Balinese village.  Bali was on my bucket list of places to visit and it did not disappoint. What makes this country special is the people and I will definitely be back.
author: Shobha H

comment: We are just back from a week’s holiday in Bali, and stayed in Melia Bali throughout. We were looking for a family-friendly resort with a kids’ club and couldn’t have asked for better. The kid’s club was spacious and clean with a big outdoor area for the daily evening movie with popcorn. My boys esp love the daily marshmallow roasting at the beach. The kids’ club activities were varied ranging from craft like bloom art to cultural activities like Balinese traditional rt and crafts, making fish and birds out of coconut leaves. We also loved that the kids got to dress up in traditional Balinese clothes to visit the hotel temple as well as to join the special Galungan procession. But above all, we love the very attentive and caring kids’ club staff, who communicated with me promptly
author: Kelly C

comment: Thank you for the room upgrade, it was amazing, we really enjoyed our stay in Melia Bali , we are happy to return soon 🙏🏻  The hotel is on the beach, we stayed in many hotels in Bali but Melia was my favourite I think Nusa Dua is one of the most beautiful beaches in Bali .  There are plenty activities , pools and beautiful gardens.  The staff was very helpful and friendly. Thank you for taking care of us ! 🙏🏻
author: Szidónia

So we moved to the Melia on another all inclusive package in the family room. We were here last September and had a great time and this visit has been just as great!  Included in our package was the Level Upgrade which has been nice for some extra perks, but with kids under 12 years old you can’t use all the extra perks such as the beautiful Level Pool. author: nettyoz

comment: Stayed here with just my daughter and I for a post-covid beach getaway. My daughter (3.5ish years at the time) had the absolute best time and experience in the kids club. Was the best by far on our tour of Bali. We hired Dani to babysit her in the kids club (children under 4 need a seperate babysitter) and my daughter adored her so much she kept wanting to go back! Was great for me as it gave me time for walks, massages etc. Make sure you try the spa at Melia - it’s next level!
author: sheareamy

author: Ayu_chieza

comment: Our whole experience here was beautiful. The hotel's environment is just stunning and is just so pleasant to be in. The room's are immaculate and so spacious. We had a lagoon access room which was incredible. So nice to be able to go for a swim straight from your room! The food was delicious. We ate in all of the restaurants. The Japanese restaurant was definitely our favourite. Special shoutout to Lily who really looked after us when we visited and was super friendly and sweet. I loved the breakfast in the Sorrento restaurant. Such a calm place to start your day, with great food and a good variety of options. Karin was an incredible waitress and remembered all of her customer's names! They have a good selection of activities that go on throughout the day. I tried the yoga and
author: Sarah L

Don't think we'll ever go back to a hotel room again! We booked the all inclusive Level Experience. From arrival we just felt relaxed, loved the lays of frangipani's, the carved coconuts with our names.  The team went through everything we needed to know, which was a lot.  Then taken to our villa, which was amazing!  It's spacious, it has everything you need.  The bed is so comfy.  Loved our own little pool, and it was never freezing cold.  The Level Staff, Yudi and Yulastitu (spelling sorry) were just so wonderful to deal with, they were so helpful, 5 stars for them, but all the staff were great, we just dealt
author: austag

comment: We were in Melia Bali for a summer holiday  in July 2022. We had a lovely experience staying in the hotel, warm staff, great services, nice swimming pool and a private access to the beach which is excellent. Breakfast was lovely, warm greetings from Dayu, Jeni & Resti every morning at the entrance of the El Patio restaurant. The whole experience was great. Will come back to stay at Melia Bali in the future when we are visiting Bali.   David & Maria Browne, Ireland.
author: Maria B

comment: Amazing hotel for families and couples for all sort of occasions. We chose it our family “dacha” and come here every weekend from Ubud. We’ve been in all 5* hotels in Bali and can afford ourselves every single place, but we choose Melia again and again for its numerous benefits for Level guests (such as royal breakfast with salmon and caviar, lobster and Champaign), amazing kids facilities and kid s club (marshmallows at the beach, popcorn and movie nights), and outstanding service from all the team.  I especially thank Mr Eduardo for a client relationship support and personal touch for every guest, Mr Moustafa for the food specialities and the team (Mr Suantara, Mrs Elena Lopez and Mr Swastika). Great team makes guests not just happy but becoming grateful ambassadors even if
author: Lana

comment: From the second we arrived at the Melia we were treated like VIPs. The staff from reception, the bar, the pool, the Sorrento restaurant were attentive and friendly. Our villa was stunning with thoughtful little touches like incense and a coffee machine- excellent selection of teas, too. The facilities are top class and immaculate. The Level package breakfast is excellent and the peach overnight oats and morning mimosas are a great start to the day! We got chatting to the restaurant staff every morning and they were kind and thoughtful. Nothing was too much trouble for Hendra, Dayv and Nisa- they looked after us so well and it was obvious that they were passionate about ensuring quality dining experiences. Even though it was quiet because of Covid, we knew that no corners were
author: Kat

comment: We had the most lovely stay at Meliá Bali. Our room was lovely and everything we’d hoped for. The Level was well worth the extra expense- especially for the adults only pool. Our stars of the trip were Pringga, Arta and Darma, the pool concierges. They looked after our every need and were polite, friendly and had great senses of humour!    Our only criticism of the hotel was the selection of food. One of the restaurants was closed, which was a shame. The others were nice but were the same every single night. Could we suggest a couple of daily specials just to add some variety for those staying for a while?   All in all, a wonderful stay. Would certainly go again.
author: George de M

comment: We have spent 10 days here in Melia Bali and I have to say the customer service has been fantastic especially the staff looking after LEVEL guests.  The hotel itself is 30 years old, but the facilities and landscape is kept to a very high standard throughout the complex. LEVEL guests are entitled to a little bit of peace and quiet in this hotel and this can be found at the dedicated pool where water and afternoon tea are served during the day. The LEVEL bar serves complementary pre evening cocktails where you can enjoy either a little peace and quiet or have a conversation with fellow guests or staff.  Any slight issues we had were dealt with efficiently and professionally and without any problem.  We spent half the last 2 days in one of the garden villas which include a private
author: Sean

comment: We stay two nights at the Melia hotel and we had such a nice time.  The room was beautiful and comfortable.  The food was exquisite.  It’s a great place to go with kids. The kids club is a awesome place to let the kids have fun and play. Dayu at the kids club took good care of my nephew and offered great and fun activities.  In the evening the kids were given marshmallows to roast on the beach, then some popcorn and watch the movie at the kids club.  You can go paddle boarding, kayaking, you can also borrow bicycles to go riding on the path along the beach.  The swimming pool is nice and big.   We had the best time and gives an opportunity to go relax and get some sun and workout during the global pandemic.  The stuff was the most kindest and use precaution to keep us the
author: Aloe B

comment: Stayed at the Melia Nusa Dua for 5 nights in September 2020. We would like to congratulate Ibu Dayu from the Kids Club who provided an exceptional service and who organized activities for our family (canang sari and explanations related to Penjor). Due to a misunderstanding, we missed the penjor activity and Ibu Dayu was very kind to have us redo the activity twice. She was very professional during our stay and organized other activities like bracelet making for our child.  We chose the junior suite for our family. The room was very clean and had been disinfected prior to our arrival, the cleaning service is on request. With Covid, only 1 restaurant was open (sateria - patio). All the servers wore face shields and were very friendly. Just one comment, the breakfast menu could be
author: Emy

comment: It was like we had never been away! :)   Having stayed here many times before, we were so pleased to find that despite the devastating affects of Covid-19 on the tourism industry in Bali, the bars, restaurants & spa were all open for service, and even better was that most of the same wonderful people still worked at the Melia Bali.  Staff don’t just work here committed to looking after customers;  we consider all to be our friends too and it was sad to leave as always.  Too many to mention all, but a special shout-out to Sumarta who took the time to call our room on arrival to welcome us back and also saw us off. A lovely man. author: rayrayyeahbaby

comment: Very beautiful resort, with so many smiling employees. Rooms start to age (especially bathrooms), but are still very comfortable. The 5 restaurants are a bit pricey for the quality. The gym was perfect with gym trainers on top of their game (thanks Ian for the many boxe sparring sessions). All in all, a great place to stay :)
author: Hien B

comment: After all the Covid restrictions, we stayed there again in one of the Garden Villas. It was our 5th stay in Villa 5 and it was like always. A dream, beautiful, comfortable and quiet. Also perfect the Level Lounge (esp. Doni and Yudi) and the Sorrento Restaurant for breakfast. Wi-Fi was working excellent this year, even at the Level pool and the beach. One day at the Level Lounge during Cocktail time, we spoke about what to do on our 35th Anniversary day. On this day, after spending some hours on the beach, we found a decorated villa with white swans, blossoms, chocklate cake and a nice letter from the manager. But this wasn‘t all, they prepared for us a romantic dinner at the beach. A special thank you for your effort, it was unforgettable. We hope to be back next years.
author: Franz K

comment: Great 5 nights at this beautiful resort, the setting is perfect and the grounds pristine! Rooms are basic but comfortable. The all inclusive package is excellent value and with 5 restaurants to choose from you have a great choice. Great for families, the kids club is fantastic and the staff are absolutely brilliant with the kids and made them feel special. The beach is always clean. Pool is fantastic with daily water aerobics  Has a great vibe about this hotel.
author: AmandatheNurse

comment: Apart from the luxury amenities and 5-star service, the genuine care and dedication the staff shows to guests is valuable beyond measure. It's created an exceptionally warm, relaxing and interactive environment for people of all ages.  Over the years, The Level Manager Miss Yuli has always made sure that we are well taken care of, makes time to reconnect, and actively finds new ways to make improvements around the hotel.  Agus is one of the many, excellent fitness instructors who is always eager to share new learnings, as well as introduce a variety of class formats - each with a wide range of health benefits for everyone to enjoy.  Whether you're looking to relax or immerse yourself in new activities, Melia has it all! I recommend them to everyone I know, without hesitation.
author: Alex Chan

comment: Even though the staff (Yuli and her team) tried their best to fix the situations, the resort doesn't have typical qualities as we have experienced at other Melia resorts.  For instance, a dedicated pool for Level families turns out to be a "backyard" of Lagoon rooms - Lagoon rooms have pools in the back of the room, and we ended up sharing these pools with the Lagoon guests.  We had paid extra $ for Level privilege for the family including kids; however, we didnt receive the extra services because kids are not allowed in many areas.  So, why were we asked / encouraged to pay more?!
author: eliteBeacher

comment: We paid for all all inclusive trip to Sol by Melia in Nusa Dua. It is an older resort but the suites were fantastic. Food, beverages including beer , wine and cocktails were all included and delivered. Mini bar in room replaced each day. Three different restaurants, live music and shows every night. Private beach at front, gym and fantastic massage salon. A fantastic swim up pool was the highlight. It lived up to its promises. A wonderful resort right on the beach at Nusa Dua.
author: Lawrence D

comment: My friends and I had an amazing experience, delightful food and cocktails. Kids enjoyed the kids club, with marshmallows on bonfire, movie nights and many other activities. While the adults were sipping mojitos at the adult only pool..service was pristine.  There are 5 different restaurants and you must try the special cocktail at the Sakura.
author: mayraouriques

comment: The kids club at the Melia is so fantastic for our  family with 2 kids aged 5 and 9. The staff are so kind, caring, attentive and make everyone feel so welcome.   Acik, Sasih, Dayui, Dani, Resi, Graney & Tya all knew our girls so well by the end of 7 days. The activities are brilliant including a walk to the temple, art and craft, beading, a bird show, a pirate afternoon, treasure hunts, pool games and every night marshmallow toasting on the beach followed by movie & popcorn.   We keep coming back to the Melia as there is no better place for parents to come and enjoy a break at such a beautiful hotel. The gardens and grounds are stunning, and there’s been many updates and renovation works in the last few years to the hotel.   Special thanks and appreciation go to the kids club
author: Claire C

comment: We had a stay for two nights in Melia. It was a great experience as all staffs treated us at extraordinary services.   Things need to revisit will be the toilet amenities such as soap.  The basin pumped got blocked somehow so the water did not flow appropriately.   Overall, love the food at the breakfast and the hotel friendly staffs!
author: Charlie Hartono

comment: First the staff, as nice and beautifil as the island. Then the hotel, very well located on a nice beach, with all the confort and the amenities you can expect from a 5 star hotel in 2022. The food, very well cooked and of good quality , with a nice variety of setup depending on the restaurant. But if you come with kids, it is WONDERLAND.., movie nights, BBQ marshmallows, tons of cool activities all day long, and more than anything a staff that LOVES kids and you can feel it. It is a pleasure for your kid to go to the kidsclub, so for the parents :) Our 4 year old son Zack keeps talking about those holidays... we will be back next year, for sure !
author: Yan P

comment: Overall very very good stay. The activities planned for adults and kids are awesome. I wish to mention the ones which we really enjoyed. Aqua Aerobics for Adults, all kids activities were fun filled and planned well. Some staff that made the stay more enjoyable were - Mas Putu and Mas Irshad for Aqua Aerobics and Mba Achi for the kids activities. But for days that were sold out Hotel
author: Vaibhav Malhotra

comment: This is a very great place to stay especially for family. They have endless of activities which will make you never feel bored! You can play kayak and paddle board in the ocean.. you can surf too. You can play bicycle and gokart while enjoying the beach view. They have yoga class in the morning and gym to exercise. We can play archery, tennis, badminton, and basketball. They even have classes for us to learn such as soccer, waterpolo, and paddle board. We also can bake marshmellow on the fire every 6 o’clock on the beach. We even can do reef walking and snorkling every day which i really love! The hotel always has an event for kids on the weekend which are so much fun.. the staffs even wear costumes and perform so well! Last time they had pirate treasure hunt games, mime who
author: adel

comment: We booked the Level Family Suite at Melia Bali. It was a pleasurable experience! We were on vacation for the first time in 2.5 years and were eagerly looking forward to it. I am happy we made a good choice because the resort staff made our stay comfortable from the get go. Huge shout out to all the staff, who despite the sudden spike in visitors, were able to service every request in the best possible way. Special mention for the ladies at Kids club - Dani, Sasih, Graney, Tya, Aci and Resi who were baby sitting kids and keeping them well engaged all the time!
author: Nishant K

comment: My family and my friends stayed at your hotel for nine nights at your resort. It was a fantastic stay and couldn't have been treated  any better. Me and would like to say how attentive your staff were and very welcoming always wearing a smile. Chef buýa from el patio I will miss his talks. April from kopa petani. Two of the pool boys haryadi and D'ianne always there with a smile and the service was nothing short of fabulous and the wonderful  basma from sateria couldn't have looked after us any better. Also young david from el patio always willing to serve. They are a credit to your company as are all your staff. We would  definitely come back again.
author: eggsyliverpool

comment: We loved the location, the beach is clean and only resort guests.   The room was clean and comfortable. We stayed as 'Level' guests and a wonderful experience. The rooms were clean and comfortable. We were to stay for 7 nights but ended up extending for another 5 nights! We moved to a lagoon room which was more updated. The family suite upstairs, the only downfall is it's a shower over bath upstairs and if you taller than about 5'8 your head will be hitting the roof! We moved to a lagoon room and it was fantastic just a shame there was a lot of children in these rooms. It was noisy and the loud in the pool outside our room.  The level staff were fantastic from check-in, to breakfast to the pool/beachside. A massive thank you to Dharma and Harry at the pool/beach for the amazing
author: Sarah B

comment: Incredible spacious resort, almost everything you need you will find inside. Various pools, private beach, gym, tennis, archery, spa, yoga and organized day trips. I tried the yoga sessions and they were amazing, very relaxing. Agus is a good leading trainer and will  help you relax and create a very unique experience so give it a try if you get there.  Our stay was very relaxing, the staff incredible and very good service.
author: IuliaGhita

comment: Very good hotel with good facilities and food. The all inclusive bundle allows for unlimited food 24/7 and full access to all activities. Any sports players ask for Alep the instructor brilliant guy 👍
author: Dejan D

comment: Amazing experience all round, everyone was extremely helpful and pleasant. In particular the ladies at the kids club were incredibly sweet with our children, making it such a great place to go. Dani was great with our eldest toddler and Maria was just incredible when babysitting both our , kids so that we could enjoy the world cup final. Really, no words to describe an incredible few days. Highly recommended
author: F M

comment: We had an amazing stay in Melia Bali, upgraded to the Level which was well worth it and the daily canape/drinks at the Level lounge was always so lovely.  Staff are fantastic everywhere, especially the Level Pool where every day each converstation was so personal.  We also attended the Bali Prayer ceremony which was fantastic to see and be involved in.  Special shout out to Adi, Darma, Suarjaya and Resti - you made our holiday and we will definately consider a return trip in the future.  Actually travelled September 2019
author: Sally L

comment: It’s a stunning hotel. The rooms are a bit old and need re doing if it claims to be a 5 star. The staff are very nice, but be careful these prices are more in line with Paris rather than Bali, I’ve been charged £42 for a pina colda and a double rum and coke. I know for a fact that is ridiculously overpriced. Shame really, has put a bit of a downer on the holiday.
author: Haroun M

comment: Bought the all inclusive deals from Luxury Escape. Check in experience was a bit disappointing. Our room wasnt ready and got told it'd be a certain time but it was exceeded by at least an hour. First impression of the resort was huge. Layout is nice. Loved the pool. Lots of activities. We dined in all 5 restaurants, all served great food. Desserts were AMAZING!! This place has got a very good pastry chef. Housemade tiramisu was my favourite - must have if you stay there! Eclairs from the cafe were also very nice. We are most happy with the kids club. Honestly the best we've come across. The activities for the kids they offered were spectacular. They have different activities throughout the day hourly. My daughter whose 4 had heaps of fun. She was there everyday and made a few
author: May R

comment: We only booked for 1 night at first, and was disappointed already during the check in process. One of the staff was not friendly at all to us and we have decided to not come back to this hotel again. But big thanks to Pak Nengah Suastika, who approached us during our breakfast and solved everything. He always makes sure that our stay is wonderful and nothing is missing or disappointing. And we ended up staying for 1 week there.  Breakfast was quite good, Pak Nengah tried to offered us coco bowl which was not on the buffet station. He also remembers that my grandma liked their croissants and their porridge too. He always bring us the croissants every morning during breakfast and remember our order.   Room is also quite nice, we stayed at the lagoon access room. The pool is
author: Angelia Wijaya

comment: Just returned from a fabulous 2 week holiday to Melia Bali .When we arrived at the hotel after a very long journey we were greeted by a lovely lady in traditional Bali dress .After this they hit the gong as we walked in which made us jump but was a lovely touch .We had booked the level.From this moment on we had a great personal service .The level has its own check in/check out lounge .They brought us some sparkling wine whilst we were given the hotel information .After this we were taken to our room by Willy who was just so helpful.As this was our 35 year wedding anniversary the hotel had made a cake and there was a card wishing us Happy Anniversary . The restaurants are all very good serving delicious food .We went on all inclusive ,which I can recommend , no need to worry
author: Maxiemoo

comment: A last minute decision checking into Melia Bali turned out an unforgettable family trip. Although the check-in experience was marred by a small mistake of not able to provide 2 connecting rooms for our family, we experienced one of the most pleasant front office services. The front office manager Ms.Gita and her staff at the reception were most attentive to our problem with a smile at all time. Not only things start to get better from there, we met so many friendly and attentive staff in Melia Bali including Cinta in Lotus restaurant and staffs at Sateria. Highly recommending the all inclusive package in this truly authentic Balinese style hotel.
author: PYWong

comment: We stayed 4 days in the Melia, loved the super breakfasts, pool area and lovely clean beach. The local area has some nice restaurants and shops. We loved the daily yoga classes, given by the excellent Agus, who was very friendly, encouraging and informative.
author: John F

comment: My family stayed here for a week with four other families. It was the perfect hotel for us and our kids. They all had a great time swimming in the pool, playing in kids club and dancing with the musicians at dinner. All staff were very kind and friendly. Maria from the kids club was a great babysitter for my son. Breakfast buffet was yum. My only suggestion is for more shade over the pool.
author: Ellie

comment: This has lifted the standards of 5 stars hotels for me forever. The place is beautiful and it's made even more beautiful by the AMAZING employees.  At Sateria Basma and Chandra have made us feel like celebrities. Always attentive, very quick to deliver our orders and communicate to us the various activities that can be enjoyed around the resort but also happy to explain to us more about the local Balinese life. We learned so much from them, and we have never seen such quality staff members anywhere else.   At the level pool Artha was so responsive and happy to help too! The staff truly lifts this place to another level of high quality customer service.  Regarding the grounds I would have appreciated if around the many beautiful ponds with fish inside there was a little plaque
author: Anda T

comment: We stayed in a room with lagoon access. This lagoon is a shared space with few other rooms but as our room was at the end,  this lagoon became a private space. We spent most of our time in this lagoon.    Overall,  this property is excellent- clean rooms,  courteous staff, great food and access to beach.    Staff is extremely prompt. During our visit to their coffee shop , Kopitian, I asked,  if they have vegan cakes.  They didn't have but had plant- based milk for coffee.  I suggested that they should have vegan options for desserts too. Next day,  their food manager came with the chef and offered to make vegan breakfast for me.  The chef prepared chia porridge which was delicious.   This was our 4th visit to Bali and by far,  the best one.
author: Priyanka P

comment: We recently returned from an all inclusive 7 night holiday at Melia Nusa Dua. It was our children’s first experience overseas and hence we chose the more secluded area of Nusa Dua for our stay. I highly recommend the all inclusive package. We enjoyed beautiful meals in lovely venues every night of our stay with amazing steaks at the beach side restaurant and the Japanese was sensational.  The pool was lovely and the kids (6&8) swam all day and we took part in the daily aqua aerobics and basketball games. The gym and outdoor classes were a welcome addition to our trip and provided some respite from the constant opportunity to eat and drink.  Special mention to the lovely Dewa Ayu from Kopi Petani. The service she provided was impeccable and she quickly learnt my coffee order even
author: Lawsiee

comment: Our experience at Sateria Restaurant was amazing. Firstly the location, on the beach, was beautiful. The whole resort was phenomenal with the best facilities and customer service. The restaurant’s menu  had a great selection of dishes and catered for all. The kids menu was also great. The happy hour cocktails were delicious as well as a vast beverage menu. What made our evening was the exceptional customer service by the lovely, ARIS. He was extremely attentive and provided a 5-star service.  We highly recommend this resort and restaurant when you are in Nusa Dua, Bali.
author: Eva J

comment: Great food, staff was amazing, friendly  and super helpful especially Agus, he was awesome. Plenty of amenities (pool, spa, gym, basketball, football, tennis, games in the pool, beach stuff) and that’s not even all of them. I would 100% recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Bali and staying in the Nusa Dua area. Fantastic place for family, friends, couples, kids. Just a good place, I can’t wait to go back!
author: Dylan K

comment: last time we stayed at the Melia Bali was october 2018.  we ve been here several times before.  Last in 2018 we were rather disappointed, we come to Bali for its culture, and we saw the staff no longer in there sarungs, at breakfast a lack of indonesian dishes, no dressing gowns in our room , and few grumpy staff members, Mrs Charlotte , management will remember that review, this time we have seen all of the negatives above turned in to a positive, very pleased with our stay and surely coming back! However I would like, to give some advise , for people on a budget, take the all-inclusive formula, or buy your drinks at the warung Naya, exemple 2 small beers will cost you, 188.000 idr out of your minibar, where at Naya's, which is just at the right side on the beach, you will pay
author: tootlepips

comment: When I went here, I was treated like royalty. In service and community. I recommend staying here, after only a few days I felt refreshed and super relaxed. The resort offers out of the resort tours! If you ever meet Joni, Beffrey or Mahendra they will take the best care of you. -Emily.
author: Emily B

comment: This is my many times visit to this hotel, and always  happy to stay here. Specially during this pandemic, they do the good health protocol, they minimize the visiting guest that coming to meet the inhouse guest which is good, so that we feel safe that not many people around the hotel area. We have to call the reception and inform the names of our visiting guest.   As always, the staff are so friendly and helpful, the service is good.  I was upgraded to lagoon access room which I thought just being renovated, all is good, clean and works well. The only problem is the seethrough bathroom curtain that make us a bit uncomfortable because other persons at the room can see the bathroom's activities, this is not major problem actually. Other than that, all is good.  The beach bar &
author: Melly S

comment: Melia Hotel is a very extraordinary hotel, from the first time I set foot here, I have felt a very natural atmosphere besides that it is also friendly service and very good facilities, beautiful scenery and there are also many playgrounds which are of course a very suitable choice for a vacation. The cool beach is accompanied by a place to relax and there is also a place to eat that makes it more complete. Don't hesitate if you want satisfying service, a beautiful place and complete facilities, just come to Melia Hotel.
author: Devi A

comment: We spent 10 days at Melia Bali and had a wonderful time. Everything was perfect. The beach, the bar, the pool, the restaurants were always clean. The food, especially the breakfast was totally delicious. There was a large selection of bread, cereals, fruit, juices, etc.. I enjoyed the breakfast very much. The service staff, especially Yuli, Resti and Adi were always helpful and extremely friendly. If you had a problem they were always there to help. I really enjoyed my time at the Melia Bali. The rooms were large and spacious. We had plenty of space and a great view of the well kept gardens. There was always live music in the evenings. This was really great.The hotel is in a great location. There is a large shopping center nearby. You can walk there in about 10 minutes. I can
author: Melanie

comment: Great ambience, very beautiful setting by the beach - outdoor seating with sea view, well lit and well decorated with lots of lanterns, live music. The food and drinks were very yummy and we really enjoyed our dinner here. Our waiter Aris was very friendly and helpful, and provided very good service. This place also lets you dine till late. Would highly recommend this place.
author: mtmx

comment: Pringga, Arta and Darma provided us with the most attentive service at our stay at the Melia. The remembered our drinks daily and came around constantly asking if there was anything else we needed. They were all genuinely nice people always happy to have a chat with their guests. They all want to make sure you have a great experience to remember and that is what they achieved!
author: Erin W

comment: My mum and I recently had a quick getaway to the Melia and it was absolutely amazing. We stayed in the family suite with the all inclusive and the level benefits included. The private pool area was absolutely perfect, it was quiet and private with no kids allowed in the pool.  The staff were the best part. Before you even have a chance to choose a seat they are helping you to pick one and set up your day bed. Constantly checking in and making sure you have enough water. They are very pro active with your drink and food orders and by the second order they knew our drink order and room number. They were very accommodating for my mum and I. Resti in particular was so friendly and easy to talk to. She was beautiful and understanding and absolutely amazing at her job. There is
author: Carla E

comment: We visited the restaurant while staying at Nusa Dua  We came twice to spent a very pleasant time by the beach and lovely atmosphere.  Food was very very good thanks to chef Bayu and very friendly and chatty staff . I recommend this place to dine, drink and stay by the pool.
author: T B

comment: I couldn't rate the Melia more highly. My mum, sister and I stayed at the Melia on an all inclusive package. Each of us have each visited Bali a number of times (11, 7 and 5 respectively) and we all agreed the Melia was our absolute favourite stay. We have been recommending it since! Service impeccable, food and drinks delicious, activities fun and pool lounges heavenly. Not only were the staff attentive and ready to help you, they would always do it with a smile. We were never left wanting. A special thank you to  Darma, Pringga and Arta who all made our time heavily. And to the beautiful Selina who runs the cafe brilliantly!  Truly a perfect holiday, thanks to the beautiful people at Melia.
author: Giulia

comment: Lovely resort positioned on the beach. Beautiful gardens. Level club great for cocktails and canapés. Level suite near the beach and very quiet. Special shout out to their customer relations intern Ari who did a magnificent job of looking after me during my stay and many other guests to from what I could see as well. Also very smart as well to try sell me an upgrade for my next stay as well which she succeeded in doing.
author: DougAlliston

comment: A perfect hotel and suitable for holidays and family reunions because it is clean, comfortable and the environment is beautiful and has complete infrastructure for family activities.  We have been for the fifth time in 2021 staying at the Melia hotel, and we are very grateful for the service that has gotten better from all of our visits, both the delicious food provided by chef Nyoman Putra Asmara and chef Rafael as well as the good service from  Mr. Hendra, Mr. Doni, Mrs. Yuni, Mrs. Putu Laba, Mrs. Parwati and all the employees so that we feel like staying at home.  And there is one point that really touches my heart where employees who have been retired from the hotel provide job opportunities for the next generation of retired employees.
author: isabelle m

comment: We came to the Melia as they had a special promotion. We had a wonderful, relaxing holiday. There was so much for the whole family: complimentary bike hire, watersports (stand up paddle boarding and kayaking), toasting marshmallows on the beach, a kids movie every night, tennis, badminton and a whole host of other activities.   All the staff were amazing and made us feel very welcome. A special shout out to Alep, who taught my son archery, with a lot of patience and encouragement. We will definitely be returning!
author: Alyssa M

comment: First time in Bali and in the Meliá resort. The all experience it was amazing. When we arrived, the resort was very busy. We were happy we did the Level Lagoon Suite. They have a private big adult only swimming pool exclusive for Level guest, and is very nice and quieter. The staff service from the Level pool is really friendly and attentive. They always go extra mile to make or experience really nice. All the restaurants is really nice but our favour are the Sakura, Lotus, El Patio and Sorrento, in general they’re all great. We would like to thank you all the staff for make our stay one the best we had. In special to Mitha (Sakura restaurant), Sudarma (El Patio), Resti (Level pool), Karin (Level breakfast), Doni (Level concierge), and all the staff from the hotel, to make our
author: CHARLES R

comment: I Love all the free activities that melia hotel provide !   From paddleboard, canoe, squash, archery, bike, tennis, badminton, fitness. Oh and they provide everything, sunblock, aloe vera, equil mineral water and also turtle floaties.  They upgraded our room to lagoon pool , which is pool just outside your room!   Everything is clean and great service
author: devi o

comment: We like the family activities in this hotel especially for kids: indoor and outdoor kid's club, toasting marshmallow, nite movie with free popcorn, feeding fish, kids yoga, and many more.  The breakfast very delicious in offshore restaurant so that we can see the beach and enjoy the sunrise.  The room is clean. We can hear the birds singing outside when wake up in the morning.
author: Ari lestari

comment: We stayed in a Level family suite, and were extremely impressed with the Level Lounge facilities. A special mention must go to Yudi in the Level Lounge - the brightest of smiles every day, professional always, and extremely helpful. He knew our party by name, remembered our preferences and even helped with medical assistance when one of our party was unwell. Nothing was too much trouble for him, which is exactly what you’d hope for from a concierge service. Melia Bali are lucky to have him - one to watch!
author: Julie W

comment: Melia Bali didnt reduce their service and quality even during pandemic. Cleanliness is also top of their priority whereas me and my family can feel safe during our trip before. And the best part is how they create fun activities for the kids.. my son was very happy and super excited and we as parents were also happy looking at him can play again outside, but with a strict healthy and clean guidelines. Thanks a lot to Melia Bali team. Wish you all to be stay healthy and safe and hope to get back there within soonest for sure. Thank You!!
author: Milky_island3

comment: We stayed here in peak and paid full price for the ‘all inclusive’. Others arrived on deals and discounts. As you can imagine our expectations were much higher than those who were on a cheap holiday.  That being said, our room was better but all other experiences were the same for us and discount guests.  The overall buildings are ok, but are getting older and in my opinion for a 5 star hotel are in need of renovation.  The Sorrento and Sakura restaurants were the highlights. Poolside service can be very slow. Staff are friendly and apologetic but there could be a more efficient way to manage the bar and poolside food - once food arrives it can then take additional time for the bill to come back for your signature, this can be frustrating especially when you are already wearing
author: WittyTraveller

comment: Dear Team Absolutely fell in love with the whole experience, being greeted at the Melia by the dancers was amazing what a fantastic start to a week of excellent service. The thing that stood out immediately was how the staff were there to ensure all your needs and comfort were met, always with a smile. Breakfast in Sorrento’s had fabulous selection of food that catered for everyone and had the option of Al fresco or air conditioned seating. I can’t praise this enough, we had Christmas swimming in the Indian Ocean on our private beach and in the pool, all set within the beautiful landscape gardens and palm trees. Wow  Sincere thanks to everyone at the Melia for an unforgettable stay Alan, Mary, Rosie & Oscar.
author: Alan

comment: Just wanted to acknowledge Pringa, Darma and Arim for their outstanding service and attention to detail during our stay at the Melia Nusa Dua. Nothing was too much trouble for these guys at the level pool and I would like to thank them very much for helping make our stay so enjoyable and memorable. Look forward to seeing them next time we visit.
author: Jo Welsh

comment: We found our second home in Melia  Bali with its very good and friendly environment for family. Especially the delicious balinese cuisine served by Chef Nyoman Putra Asmara with his assistant Mr Hendra who is always very warm friendly with his team to treat us so comfortably. Also thanks to Mr Doni is always very helpful with all the check in and information.
author: Jusniaty C

comment: We were excited to be coming to Melia Bali after being recommended by friends.  From the moment we arrived we felt very welcomed by the beautiful staff.  The attention and professionalism we were shown was fantastic. We were in Building 3 on the garden level and very comfortable in our room.  The restaurants, bars, pool area and activities were first class.  Nusa duo is a lovely area to holiday in for relaxation and Melia is positioned well.   I can’t comment enough on the attention from all the gracious Melia Bali staff, they have made our holiday very special.  Bayu at the Japanese restaurant paid extra attention to us with his artwork of making my name out of rice at the tepanaki
author: Sharon

comment: We stayed at the Melia, Nusa Dua for 7 nights. There was a mix up at the beginning of the trip and we had to change rooms on day two, the staff were understanding and process was smooth and we were happy with the outcome. All of the staff were lovely and our two girls aged 6 and 2 had the best time. In fact my 6 year old didn't want to leave!! Thank you so much to Dani from the kids club who was so accommodating and helpful to our two girls, they still mention Dani's name from time to time and cannot wait to go back! Great Christmas Eve dinner with a magician walking around and the kids singing carols. We have fantastic memories of our family holiday and will go back to Melia in the future!
author: Explore.More

comment: This was our first visit to Bali and I have to say the Meliá Hotel in Nusa Dua absolutely fantastic, the level of service food was second to one. The staff were very friendly and kind we are definitely planning to go back the sea just a stone throw away and not too deep about waist height would highly recommend to anyone thinking of going. We traveled 26th January 2020 and the weather was great 80f so if your thinking about it do it as great place lovely people 5XXXXX  Allan & Jane from York
author: sparkyally

comment: Just arrived back from Bali today.i never right reviews but I think the Melia deserves one.We celebrated our belated honeymoon, due to covid and it was also my 60th birthday. We were made to feel very special and I had a surprise rendition of happy birthday from the staff at the Sorrento restaurant at breakfast, which was a total shock for me .We stayed in a Lagoon Access Suite, with Level Access. The room was brilliant ,very clean ,water & minibar stocked daily, open the patio doors & there's your Lagoon. Every single staff member were fantastic, nothing was too much trouble and you are truly spoilt. Everyone from the garden staff to management has a smile on their face & a warm greeting every day. Well done Melia we had a most fantastic holiday / honeymoon.  Best wishes  Mr
author: Mick L

comment: Thank god we only spent one night at the Melia. The room was rather old with no charm but the real annoyance was the A/C that cooled the air but did not dry it. As a result everything felt damp and in the morning the floor was so humid it was slippery. The staff was very kind but, at least in the international restaurant at the beach, not really up to the task. They wanted to serve the starter after the main course.
author: miodmu

comment: The hotel is really nice. The restaurants are too expensive (my opinion) so we had diner outside many times.  The staff is superb. Their genuine friendliness is really nice. They made us feel really appreciated.  Especially the pool and poolstaff (Agus, Alep, Ean) were great with kids (and adults).  Thank you so much for 3 great weeks!
author: Mike H

comment: Will stay again in this lovely property!  Stayed two nights on 5-7 Dec 2020 in the Drupardi Villa.   Recommended for family stay as well as for honeymooners. A good idea for staycation.   The staff are helpful and friendly.   Buffet bfast (standard, due to the pandemic. But, it was OK) was provided bcause there were enough guests for it.  The design of the villa is luxurious (both the interior and the exterior. Easy to find spots for taking photos and selfies. Also love the main garden and the beachfront.  If you want the floating basket for bfast in your villa, you should make a confirmation at the latest 6pm on the day before.
author: Franky

comment: It has been 3days since I've left Melia Bali, and I've already missed a lot! I could certainly say, it is, the best hotel ever.  This was my first time in Bali, and although I've traveled many places, I've never seen such kind of attractive hotel.  First of all, the scenery you see there is so beautiful. Of course the weather is one thing you'll love in Bali, but I'd like to say, the most important thing is, that the staffs in Melia Bali keep the place wonderful. Their work are so neat. You could understand what I'm saying just with the very first sight.  And secondary, as I've already said, the staffs are so amazing. Every staff works wearing their beautiful smile and they made our time so fabulous. Especially I want to thank Ephy, who took us to Uluwatu temple tour, he was
author: mruk0

comment: We've had a wonderful day at Melia Bali, the personel was very welcoming, friendly and tried not only to fulfill, but foresee all our wishes, which they did amazingly. It's a highly recommended place at a wonderful beach. Special thanks to Gunawan, Letha, Suardana and Detika! We've had a great time, thanks to you.
author: van_der_sort

comment: it is time for hotel melia to be renovated in several places, both rooms and facilities that look old or damaged, so it will look beautiful again.  experience of staying 3 days 2 nights is satisfying for us.  we will come back again someday.  tq
author: faricky

comment: We had the most relaxing holiday in this hotel 😍 We could not stop raving about the All Inclusive package! Totally worth it.   We got to try all of their culinary offers without worry, also got to join the activities. We wanted to join the Uluwatu Temple tour which was included in the package, but we were in a food coma after eating delicious lunch at Sateria so we ended up not going. But we got to join the bicycle tour which was fantastic!  Shoutout to all the lovely staff who made the stay even more enjoyable. Especially Gunk and Made from the entertainment team who made sure we had a great fun.  Not to forget Epiyanti who made sure our arrival experience was flawless!  Thank you Melia for a truly relaxing holiday ❤️
author: seashell

comment: We loved our stay at the Melia so much and didn't want to leave.  The location along the beach is amazing, even on a windy day. We loved going for walks along the beach and to the Bali Collection shopping mall.  We had the all-inclusive package. There was so much delicious food and drinks to choose from.Everything on the menu was included, except for lobster, and wine. We enjoyed all the restaurants, with Japanese and Chinese being our favourites. Our 9 year old daughter was also very happy with the kids menu, which was quite consistent throughout the restaurants.  She could have ice cream, or freshly squeezed juices anytime. We didn't get to take advantage of the room service (which was also included) as we were full from breakfast, lunch and dinner.  The pool was great, and we
author: Eve Cee

comment: If you plan to bring your children to have holiday in Bali, then Melia hotel is a perfect hotel. Located in Nusa Dua, the beach is more clean and serene comparing with Kuta beach. While children play in beach, you can enjoy beautiful sceneryof mount Batur and Mount Agung with the ocean in front of them while enjoying some cool drink in Sateria beach restaurant. The hotel provide bicycle and canoe. You can cycling around Nusa Dua area and canoing in the blue ocean. Don't forget to take picture while you swing in the beach or just lying down at hammock. The hospitality, services, foods, everything is perfect
author: erlitapratiwi04

comment: The time I spent in Melia was very wonderful. I booked the family room and it’s very spacious. Their hotel was kind of exclusive, which is good, to ensure the safety of the guests. Their breakfast remains one of my favourites. They served Western and Indonesian cuisine. My favourite dish there is the mozzarella cheese and ham omelette. Also, I could do many activities such as riding a bicycle, playing archery, canoeing, etc. In there, I met Kak Ian while playing archery. He was really nice to me and my sister. He taught us how to play archery in the proper way. Thank you, kak Ian! Another thing I love is their private beach, it’s very beautiful and clean. If I had the chance to visit Bali in the future, I’d love to stay here again!
author: Natasha S

comment: You can take free yoga class in the morning, and it’s soooo nice!!! Agus, the yoga master, is so kind and nice. You can stretch your body with a stick listening to the ocean And birds are chirping. And they even provide lovely tea after the class. It’s the best way to start your holiday and feel the nature!
author: Ligea

comment: My husband and I just spent a week here and absolutely loved it. We had level Lagoon access room, highly reccomend paying a little extra for level perks. The staff go above and beyond and are always accommodating. I have never stayed at a place with such amazing service from the minute we arrived until we left. We will be returning!!!
author: CJNarvo

comment: Staying at Melia during crazy covid crisis is one of the best thing you can do if you stay in Bali. Going with your kids is even better ! The Kids Club gives the adults the opportunity of a real free time to rest on the "Cabana"on the beach. Staff is so helpful ! Rooms and Villas are just affordable right now, take your chance to say in a 5 stars hotel for the price of a 3 *. Enjoy the long resting day (check out is at 6 pm) on the beach without a mask !  Eat at the beach restaurant, or in the "cabanas"right on the beach. The place to be to stay happy and relax.
author: Sistiana S

comment: Me and my friends booked one hour padel trough the app «Indo Padel».The price was 75.000. When we arrived they charged us 280.000, with no discoint for the misstake in the app. This is a 5 star hotel.  The service SHOULD BE BETTER!  We will not play padel here again!
author: Benedicte
